data.v: इहाहं यदि तिष्ठामि स्वेन रूपेण संवृतः । विनाशमुपयास्यामि भर्तुरर्थश्च हीयते ।।
data.es: 'I will surely meet with death if I hide here in my original form and my master's mission also will be spoilt.

data.v: तदहं स्वेन रूपेण रजन्यां ह्रस्वतां गतः । लङ्कामभिपतिष्यामि राघवस्यार्थसिद्धये ।।
data.es: 'Therefore I shall transform myself into a tiny form and jump about the city of Lanka during night time in order to accomplish Raghava's purpose.

data.v: रावणस्य पुरीं रात्रौ प्रविश्य सुदुरासदाम् । विचिन्वन्भवनं सर्वं द्रक्ष्यामि जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'Entering by night the inaccessible city of Ravana, I shall search all over the palace and find Sita'.

data.v: इति संचिन्त्य हनुमान्सूर्यस्यास्तमयं कपिः । आचकाङ्क्षे तदा वीरा वैदेह्या दर्शनोत्सुकः । पृषदंशकमात्रः सन्बभूवाद्भुतदर्शनः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: मरजज], अज्ञातम् [१२: सभयत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततम]

data.es: Having planned in that manner the heroic Hanuman keen to see Sita waited for the Sunset.

data.v: प्रदोषकाले हनुमांस्तूर्णमुत्पत्य वीर्यवान् । प्रविवेश पुरीं रम्यां सुविभक्तमहापथम् ।।
data.es: As soon as dusk had set in, courageous Hanuman jumped in and entered the well laidout royal path of the beautiful city.

data.v: प्रासादमालाविततां स्तम्भैः काञ्चनराजतैः । शातकुम्भमयैर्जालैर्गन्धर्वनगरोपमाम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw the city stretched with rows of buildings all over,with seven or eight storied mansions, which had pillars of gold and silver, windows with fretwork of gold, inlaid with crystals, floors decorated with gold, resembling the grand city of gandharvas.

data.v: सप्तभौमाष्टभौमैश्च स ददर्श महापुरीम् । तलैः स्फाटिकसंपूर्णैः कार्तस्वरविभूषितैः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw the city stretched with rows of buildings all over,with seven or eight storied mansions, which had pillars of gold and silver, windows with fretwork of gold, inlaid with crystals, floors decorated with gold, resembling the grand city of gandharvas.

data.v: वैदूर्यमणिचित्रैश्च मुक्ताजालविभूषितैः । तलैः शुशुभिरे तानि भवनान्यत्र रक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: Inlaid with precious gems and fretwork, and ornamented with pearls, the mansions of demons looked splendid.

data.v: काञ्चनानि विचित्राणि तोरणानि च रक्षसाम् । लङ्कामुद्द्योतयामासुः सर्वतः समलंकृताम् ।।
data.es: The golden archways of the demon were colourful. They illuminated the well decorated Lanka from all sides.

data.v: अचिन्त्यामद्भुताकारां दृष्ट्वा लङ्कां महाकपिः । आसीद्विषण्णो हृष्टश्च वैदेह्या दर्शनोत्सुकः ।।
data.es: Beholding Lanka of unimaginable, wonderful glory, the great monkey keen to see Sita became sad as well as elated at once (He did not know how to find Sita in that city and felt sad. But he was also elated that he was going to meet her at any cost.)

data.v: स पाण्डुरोद्विद्धविमानमालिनीं; महार्हजाम्बूनदजालतोरणाम् । यशस्विनां रावणबाहुपालितां; क्षपाचरैर्भीमबलैः समावृताम् ।।
data.es: He found that famed place with a garland of tall, white mansions, conspicuous with archways latticed with gold strings, protected by mighty Ravana and surrounded by terrific demons.

data.v: चन्द्रोऽपि साचिव्यमिवास्य कुर्वं;स्तारागणैर्मध्यगतो विराजन् । ज्योत्स्नावितानेन वितत्य लोक;मुत्तिष्ठते नैकसहस्ररश्मिः ।।
data.es: Even the Moon rose with thousands of rays in the centre of multitudes of stars overspreading and illumining the world with a canopy of bright beams, as if to render ministerial help to Hanuman.

data.v: शङ्खप्रभं क्षीरमृणालवर्ण;मुद्गच्छमानं व्यवभासमानम् । ददर्श चन्द्रं स कपिप्रवीरः; पोप्लूयमानं सरसीव हंसं ।।
data.es: The heroic vanara saw the rising Moon flitting in and out shining like a fresh white conch, in the colour of milk and lotus stalks, bright like a swan floating in the lakelike sky. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: स लम्बशिखरे लम्बे लम्बतोयदसंनिभे । सत्त्वमास्थाय मेधावी हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The mighty son of the Windgod, intelligent Hanuman, an elephant among vanaras, standing on the peak of the Lamba which looked like a high rainbearing cloud and relying on his energy, entered by night the city of Lanka, ruled by Ravana rich in delightful forests, groves and water pools.

data.v: निशि लङ्कां महासत्त्वो विवेश कपिकुञ्जरः । रम्यकाननतोयाढ्यां पुरीं रावणपालिताम् ।।
data.es: The mighty son of the Windgod, intelligent Hanuman, an elephant among vanaras, standing on the peak of the Lamba which looked like a high rainbearing cloud and relying on his energy, entered by night the city of Lanka, ruled by Ravana rich in delightful forests, groves and water pools.

data.v: शारदाम्बुधरप्रख्यैर्भवनैरुपशोभिताम् । सागरोपमनिर्घोषां सागरानिलसेविताम् ।।
सुपुष्टबलसंगुप्तां यथैव विटपावतीम् । चारुतोरणनिर्यूहां पाण्डुरद्वारतोरणाम् ।।
भुजगाचरितां गुप्तां शुभां भोगवतीमिव । तां सविद्युद्घनाकीर्णां ज्योतिर्मार्गनिषेविताम् ।।
चण्डमारुतनिर्ह्रादां यथेन्द्रस्यामरावतीम् । शातकुम्भेन महता प्राकारेणाभिसंवृताम् ।।
किङ्किणीजालघोषाभिः पताकाभिरलंकृताम् । आसाद्य सहसा हृष्टः प्राकारमभिपेदिवान् ।।
विस्मयाविष्टहृदयः पुरीमालोक्य सर्वतः । जाम्बूनदमयैर्द्वारैर्वैदूर्यकृतवेदिकैः ।।
मणिस्फटिक मुक्ताभिर्मणिकुट्टिमभूषितैः । तप्तहाटकनिर्यूहै राजतामलपाण्डुरैः ।।
वैदूर्यतलसोपानैः स्फाटिकान्तरपांसुभिः । चारुसंजवनोपेतैः खमिवोत्पतितैः शुभैः ।।
क्रौञ्चबर्हिणसंघुष्टे राजहंसनिषेवितैः । तूर्याभरणनिर्घोषैः सर्वतः प्रतिनादिताम् ।।
वस्वोकसाराप्रतिमां समीक्ष्य नगरीं ततः । खमिवोत्पतितां लङ्कां जहर्ष हनुमान्कपिः ।।
तां समीक्ष्य पुरीं लङ्कां राक्षसाधिपतेः शुभाम् । अनुत्तमामृद्धियुतां चिन्तयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Gazing at the enchanting, auspicious, prosperous city of the king of demons mighty Hanuman began to reflect:

data.v: नेयमन्येन नगरी शक्या धर्षयितुं बलात् । रक्षिता रावणबलैरुद्यतायुधधारिभिः ।।
data.es: 'It is not possible to attack this city by to outsiders as it is protected by the forces of Ravana with their weapons ready(to attack).

data.v: कुमुदाङ्गदयोर्वापि सुषेणस्य महाकपेः । प्रसिद्धेयं भवेद्भूमिर्मैन्दद्विविदयोरपि ।।
data.es: 'This land can be reached by Kumuda and Angada or the great vanara Sushena and even by Mainda and Dvivida.

data.v: विवस्वतस्तनूजस्य हरेश्च कुशपर्वणः । ऋक्षस्य केतुमालस्य मम चैव गतिर्भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'Son of Vivaswan (Sugriva), the chief of vanaras, Kushaparva, Riksha (Jambavan) and myself also will be able to reach this place.

data.v: समीक्ष्य तु महाबाहो राघवस्य पराक्रमम् । लक्ष्मणस्य च विक्रान्तमभवत्प्रीतिमान्कपिः ।।
data.es: Reflecting upon the valour of longarmed Rama and valiant advances of Lakshmana Hamuman felt pleased (within himself).

data.v: तां रत्नवसनोपेतां कोष्ठागारावतंसकाम् । यन्त्रागारस्तनीमृद्धां प्रमदामिव भूषिताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman looked at the city of the demon king, whose darkness was dispelled by bright gems and mighty mansions as if it were a young maiden. The prosperous city was like a well decorated woman, adorned with ornaments having walls for her dress, the stables for her earrings, the armouries for her breasts.

data.v: तां नष्टतिमिरां दीपैर्भास्वरैश्च महागृहैः । नगरीं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman looked at the city of the demon king, whose darkness was dispelled by bright gems and mighty mansions as if it were a young maiden. The prosperous city was like a well decorated woman, adorned with ornaments having walls for her dress, the stables for her earrings, the armouries for her breasts.

data.v: प्रविष्टः सत्त्वसंपन्नो निशायां मारुतात्मजः । स महापथमास्थाय मुक्तापुष्पविराजितम् ।।
data.es: The son of the Windgod, endowed with great strength, entered the enchanting Lanka and walked along the highway set with flowers of pearls.

data.v: हसितोद्घुष्टनिनदैस्तूर्यघोष पुरः सरैः । वज्राङ्कुशनिकाशैश्च वज्रजालविभूषितैः । गृहमेधैः पुरी रम्या बभासे द्यौरिवाम्बुदैः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: सभयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसजय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमनत]

data.es: The houses reverberating with sounds of laughter and of musical instruments, decorated with lattice windows of diamonds resembled the sky shining with clouds with a goad made of diamond (thunderbolt of Indra).

data.v: प्रजज्वाल तदा लङ्का रक्षोगणगृहैः शुभैः । सिताभ्रसदृशैश्चित्रैः पद्मस्वस्तिकसंस्थितैः । वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि सर्वतः सुविभाषितैः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरनम], अज्ञातम् [१२: यसमभ]

data.es: The city of Lanka appeared radiant with its tall mansions resembling white clouds. The mansions had auspicious marks of lotus and swastika engraved on them and were opening in the direction of the south.

data.v: तां चित्रमाल्याभरणां कपिराजहितंकरः । राघवार्थं चरञ्श्रीमान्ददर्श च ननन्द च ।।
data.es: Glorious Hanuman, wellwisher of Sugriva, king of vanaras, looked around the city, decorated with colourful garlands. Surveying it for the cause of Raghava, he was greatly delighted.

data.v: शुश्राव मधुरं गीतं त्रिस्थानस्वरभूषितम् । स्त्रीणां मदसमृद्धानां दिवि चाप्सरसामिव ।।
data.es: He heard melodious songs of intoxicated women set to tune in three places namely chest, throat and head and three pitches known as mandra (slow) madhya (medium) and tara (high). The songs resembled those of the apsarasas well set in musical notes set to music.

data.v: शुश्राव काञ्चीनिनादं नूपुराणां च निःस्वनम् । सोपाननिनदांश्चैव भवनेषु महात्मनम् । आस्फोटितनिनादांश्च क्ष्वेडितांश्च ततस्ततः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमनत], अज्ञातम् [१२: ततमय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यतभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससयभ]

data.es: Great Hanuman heard the jingling sounds of waist bells and anklets of women and sounds of great men climbing up and down flights of steps, sounds of clapping and joking everywhere in the mansions.

data.v: स्वाध्याय निरतांश्चैव यातुधानान्ददर्श सः । रावणस्तवसंयुक्तान्गर्जतो राक्षसानपि ।।
data.es: He heard chantings of sacred verses in the houses of demons engaged in the study of the vedas. And heard demons singing loudly the eulogy of Ravana.

data.v: राजमार्गं समावृत्य स्थितं रक्षोबलं महत् । ददर्श मध्यमे गुल्मे राक्षसस्य चरान्बहून् ।।
data.es: He observed large contingents of demons lining the highway and spies of Ravana stationed in the middle of the city.

data.v: दीक्षिताञ्जटिलान्मुण्डान्गोऽजिनाम्बरवाससः । दर्भमुष्टिप्रहरणानग्निकुण्डायुधांस्तथा ।।
कूटमुद्गरपाणींश्च दण्डायुधधरानपि । एकाक्षानेककर्णांश्च चलल्लम्बपयोधरान् ।।
करालान्भुग्नवक्त्रांश्च विकटान्वामनांस्तथा । धन्विनः खड्गिनश्चैव शतघ्नी मुसलायुधान् । परिघोत्तमहस्तांश्च विचित्रकवचोज्ज्वलान् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यसनर], अज्ञातम् [१२: यसजज], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभय], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततत]

data.v: नातिष्ठूलान्नातिकृशान्नातिदीर्घातिह्रस्वकान् । विरूपान्बहुरूपांश्च सुरूपांश्च सुवर्चसः ।।
शक्तिवृक्षायुधांश्चैव पट्टिशाशनिधारिणः । क्षेपणीपाशहस्तांश्च ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
स्रग्विणस्त्वनुलिप्तांश्च वराभरणभूषितान् । तीक्ष्णशूलधरांश्चैव वज्रिणश्च महाबलान् ।।
data.es: The great monkey saw the demons who held shaktis and trees as weapons (Shakti is a lance), some held threepointed spears, missiles and slings with which missiles are hurled. Some of them wore flower garlands, smeared unguents on their body and were bedecked with choicest ornaments. They were dressed in several ways and many of them moved freely. They were very strong and held sharp tridents and armed with thunderboltlike weapons.

data.v: शतसाहस्रमव्यग्रमारक्षं मध्यमं कपिः । प्राकारावृतमत्यन्तं ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw in front of the harem one hundred thousand strong, vigilant soldiers of a middle rank ordered by the lord of demons.

data.v: त्रिविष्टपनिभं दिव्यं दिव्यनादविनादितम् । वाजिहेषितसंघुष्टं नादितं भूषणैस्तथा ।।
रथैर्यानैर्विमानैश्च तथा गजहयैः शुभैः । वारणैश्च चतुर्दन्तैः श्वेताभ्रनिचयोपमैः ।।
भूषितं रुचिरद्वारं मत्तैश्च मृगपक्षिभिः । राक्षसाधिपतेर्गुप्तमाविवेश गृहं कपिः ।।
ततः स मध्यं गतमंशुमन्तं; ज्योत्स्नावितानं महदुद्वमन्तम् । ददर्श धीमान्दिवि भानुमन्तं; गोष्ठे वृषं मत्तमिव भ्रमन्तम् ।।
data.es: Then intelligent Hanuman observed the Moon in the central part of the sky spreading a canopy of his luminescence like the Sun, and looking like an intoxicated mighty (white) bull moving in a stable.

data.v: लोकस्य पापानि विनाशयन्तं; महोदधिं चापि समेधयन्तम् । भूतानि सर्वाणि विराजयन्तं; ददर्श शीतांशुमथाभियान्तम् ।।
data.es: While moving forward, Hanuman saw the Moon spreading his light, thereby warding off the agony of all creatures, causing the swelling of the ocean and illuminating the earth as well as the sky.

data.v: या भाति लक्ष्मीर्भुवि मन्दरस्था; तथा प्रदोषेषु च सागरस्था । तथैव तोयेषु च पुष्करस्था; रराज सा चारुनिशाकरस्था ।।
data.es: 'The same splendour on the Mandara mountain on earth, which glows at dusk lay on the ocean is there, on lotuses in the lakes and on the beautiful Moon also.

data.v: हंसो यथा राजतपञ्जुरस्थः; सिंहो यथा मन्दरकन्दरस्थः । वीरो यथा गर्वितकुञ्जरस्थ;श्चन्द्रोऽपि बभ्राज तथाम्बरस्थः ।।
data.es: 'Like a swan in a cage of silver, like a lion in a cave of Mandara mountain, like a hero on a proud, intoxicated elephant, the Moon shone in the sky.

data.v: स्थितः ककुद्मानिव तीक्ष्णशृङ्गो; महाचलः श्वेत इवोच्चशृङ्गः । हस्तीव जाम्बूनदबद्धशृङ्गो; विभाति चन्द्रः परिपूर्णशृङ्गः ।।
data.es: The fullmoon with its hornlike spot shone like a bull with sharp horns, like the white Himalayan mountain with its lofty peaks, and like an elephant with gold plated tusks

data.v: प्रकाशचन्द्रोदयनष्टदोषः; प्रवृद्धरक्षः पिशिताशदोषः । रामाभिरामेरितचित्तदोषः; स्वर्गप्रकाशो भगवान्प्रदोषः ।।
data.es: At the time of moonrise, the darkness of dusk is dispelled, the dark deeds of cannibals disappear, the natural instinct for love returns to women as the radiance of the Moon spreads everywhere like in heaven.

data.v: तन्त्री स्वनाः कर्णसुखाः प्रवृत्ताः; स्वपन्ति नार्यः पतिभिः सुवृत्ताः । नक्तंचराश्चापि तथा प्रवृत्ता; विहर्तुमत्यद्भुतरौद्रवृत्ताः ।।
data.es: Pleasing sounds of string instruments had begun to be heard. Chaste women were found asleep with their husbands.The nightrangers had begun their strange (evil and cruel) deeds exhibiting their anger.

data.v: मत्तप्रमत्तानि समाकुलानि; रथाश्वभद्रासनसंकुलानि । वीरश्रिया चापि समाकुलानि; ददर्श धीमान्स कपिः कुलानि ।।
data.es: Intelligent Hanuman, the great warrior, observed there in the prosperous mansions, demons proud of their wealth, highly intoxicated and dull, their houses full of horsedrawn chariots with comfortable seats.

data.v: परस्परं चाधिकमाक्षिपन्ति; भुजांश्च पीनानधिविक्षिपन्ति । मत्तप्रलापानधिविक्षिपन्ति; मत्तानि चान्योन्यमधिक्षिपन्ति ।।
data.es: The intoxicated demons were quarrelling, ridiculing one another bitterly and wildly throwing their stout arms on one another, indulging in incoherent talk, uttering vulgar words.

data.v: रक्षांसि वक्षांसि च विक्षिपन्ति; गात्राणि कान्तासु च विक्षिपन्ति । ददर्श कान्ताश्च समालपन्ति; तथापरास्तत्र पुनः स्वपन्ति ।।
data.es: The demons were seen expanding their chests sportively and caressing their wives by placing their limbs on them. They were assuming wonderful forms, and drawing their bows up to their ears.

data.v: महागजैश्चापि तथा नदद्भिः; सूपूजितैश्चापि तथा सुसद्भिः । रराज वीरैश्च विनिःश्वसद्भि;र्ह्रदो भुजङ्गैरिव निःश्वसद्भिः ।।
data.es: There were huge elephants trumpeting, respected people, warriors sighing for the lack of enemies (to vanquish). It had a lake infested with hissing snakes.

data.v: बुद्धिप्रधानान्रुचिराभिधाना;न्संश्रद्दधानाञ्जगतः प्रधानान् । नानाविधानान्रुचिराभिधाना;न्ददर्श तस्यां पुरि यातुधानान् ।।
data.es: He saw there in the city of Lanka, demons, who were intellectuals, pleasing in words, with faith in religion, preeminent heroes of the world of different kinds, followers of good practices and with lovely names.

data.v: ननन्द दृष्ट्वा स च तान्सुरूपा;न्नानागुणानात्मगुणानुरूपान् । विद्योतमानान्स च तान्सुरूपा;न्ददर्श कांश्चिच्च पुनर्विरूपान् ।।
data.es: He rejoiced to see the handsome demons radiant with forms commensurate with their virtues. He also saw some ugly figures, their traits in conformity to their forms.

data.v: ततो वरार्हाः सुविशुद्धभावा;स्तेषां स्त्रियस्तत्र महानुभावाः । प्रियेषु पानेषु च सक्तभावा; ददर्श तारा इव सुप्रभावाः ।।
data.es: There he saw demonesses adorned with choicest ornaments, their minds attached faithfully to their husbands and bottles of wine. Some of the wives of the demons, however, looked gentle and bright like stars.

data.v: श्रिया ज्वलन्तीस्त्रपयोपगूढा; निशीथकाले रमणोपगूढाः । ददर्श काश्चित्प्रमदोपगूढा; यथा विहंगाः कुसुमोपगूडाः ।।
data.es: There he saw cheerful demonesses shining brightly, abashed by the embrace of their beloveds during the night. He also saw those sporting with their beloveds freely and looking like birds embracing flowers.

data.v: अन्याः पुनर्हर्म्यतलोपविष्टा;स्तत्र प्रियाङ्केषु सुखोपविष्टाः । भर्तुः प्रिया धर्मपरा निविष्टा; ददर्श धीमान्मनदाभिविष्टाः ।।
data.es: Intelligent Hanuman saw demonesses seated happily on the laps of their beloved ones on the terraces of the mansions, exhibiting their attachment to one another, overwhelmed with sexual pleasure.

data.v: अप्रावृताः काञ्चनराजिवर्णाः; काश्चित्परार्ध्यास्तपनीयवर्णाः । पुनश्च काश्चिच्छशलक्ष्मवर्णाः; कान्तप्रहीणा रुचिराङ्गवर्णाः ।।
data.es: Ogresses without veil, some altruistic, some separated from their husbands looked pale like the Moon, though possessed of polished gold complexion.

data.v: ततः प्रियान्प्राप्य मनोऽभिरामा;न्सुप्रीतियुक्ताः प्रसमीक्ष्य रामाः । गृहेषु हृष्टाः परमाभिरामा; हरिप्रवीरः स ददर्श रामाः ।।
data.es: That heroic monkey saw ogresses delighted in the happy company of their loved ones who have joined them, ecstatic wives in the houses.

data.v: चन्द्रप्रकाशाश्च हि वक्त्रमाला; वक्राक्षिपक्ष्माश्च सुनेत्रमालाः । विभूषणानां च ददर्श मालाः; शतह्रदानामिव चारुमालाः ।।
data.es: He saw rows of faces of shedemons shining like moonlight with sidelong glances and graceful eyelashes wearing ornaments resembling charmimg flashes of lightning.

data.v: न त्वेव सीतां परमाभिजातां; पथि स्थिते राजकुले प्रजाताम् । लतां प्रफुल्लामिव साधुजातां; ददर्श तन्वीं मनसाभिजाताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman could not find Sita anywhere, an excellent lady born in a noble royal family, adopting the right path, a lady delicate like a blossoming creeper of good breed, or so he imagined.

data.v: सनातने वर्त्मनि संनिविष्टां; रामेक्षणीं तां मदनाभिविष्टाम् । भर्तुर्मनः श्रीमदनुप्रविष्टां; स्त्रीभ्यो वराभ्यश्च सदा विशिष्टाम् ।।
data.es: 'Sita must have had a pair of beautiful eyes. She must have been a passionate lady with mind fixed on her glorious husband. Ever established in dharma, she is perhaps a distinguished lady compared to her counterparts (in Lanka).

data.v: उष्णार्दितां सानुसृतास्रकण्ठीं; पुरा वरार्होत्तमनिष्ककण्ठीम् । सुजातपक्ष्मामभिरक्तकण्ठीं; वने प्रवृत्तामिव नीलकण्ठीम् ।।
data.es: She whose neck was adorned with costly ornaments earlier must be shedding hot tears now, her throat choked with grief. With her beautiful eyelashes and a sweet loving voice, she would be now like a peahen wandering in the woods.

data.v: अव्यक्तलेखामिव चन्द्रलेखां; पांसुप्रदिग्धामिव हेमलेखाम् । क्षतप्ररूढामिव बाणलेखां; वायुप्रभिन्नामिव मेघलेखाम् ।।
data.es: She would be like a barely visible ray of the Moon, like a streak of gold covered with dust, like an unhealed scar of a wound caused by an arrow only superficially covered and like a flake of cloud swept off by the wind.

data.v: सीतामपश्यन्मनुजेश्वरस्य; रामस्य पत्नीं वदतां वरस्य । बभूव दुःखाभिहतश्चिरस्य; प्लवंगमो मन्द इवाचिरस्य ।।
data.es: Hanuman stood griefstricken, having (unsuccessfully) searched for a long time for the wife of Rama, the lord of men. The highly eloquent was now despondent. For a while he looked dull and dejected.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: स निकामं विनामेषु विचरन्कामरूपधृक् । विचचार कपिर्लङ्कां लाघवेन समन्वितः ।।
data.es: The mighty Hanuman, who could assume any form at will, not finding Sita in the tall mansions, again started rapidly ranging in Lanka.

data.v: आससादाथ लक्ष्मीवान्राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशनम् । प्राकारेणार्कवर्णेन भास्वरेणाभिसंवृतम् ।।
data.es: Then he reached the residence of the lord of demons enclosed by a red colour compound wall dazzling like the midday Sun.

data.v: रक्षितं राक्षसैर्भीमैः सिंहैरिव महद्वनम् । समीक्षमाणो भवनं चकाशे कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
data.es: The elephant among vanaras (Hanuman), scanned the mansion defended by dreadful demons like a forest protected by lions.

data.v: रूप्यकोपहितैश्चित्रैस्तोरणैर्हेमभूषितैः । विचित्राभिश्च कक्ष्याभिर्द्वारैश्च रुचिरैर्वृतम् ।।
data.es: He saw beautiful silver archways decorated with gold, colourful inner apartments with beauteous entrances.

data.v: गजास्थितैर्महामात्रैः शूरैश्च विगतश्रमैः । उपस्थितमसंहार्यैर्हयैः स्यन्दनयायिभिः ।।
data.es: (He saw) archways guarded by riders mounted on majestic elephants and unwearied riders of chariots drawn by horses of irresistible speed kept ready.

data.v: सिंहव्याघ्रतनुत्राणैर्दान्तकाञ्चनराजतैः । घोषवद्भिर्विचित्रैश्च सदा विचरितं रथैः ।।
data.es: There were wonderful chariots covered with skins of lions and tigers, encrusted with ivory, gold and silver with ringing bells moving about.

data.v: बहुरत्नसमाकीर्णं परार्ध्यासनभाजनम् । महारथसमावासं महारथमहासनम् ।।
data.es: The palace was embellished with excellent seats and vessels with many precious gems. There were spacious places to accommodate big chariorts filled with shouts of great charioteers.

data.v: दृश्यैश्च परमोदारैस्तैस्तैश्च मृगपक्षिभिः । विविधैर्बहुसाहस्रैः परिपूर्णं समन्ततः ।।
data.es: It was pleasing with several kinds of beautiful beasts in their thousands all over.

data.v: विनीतैरन्तपालैश्च रक्षोभिश्च सुरक्षितम् । मुख्याभिश्च वरस्त्रीभिः परिपूर्णं समन्ततः ।।
data.es: The place was full of beautful women, carefully protected by disciplined guards as well as demons.

data.v: मुदितप्रमदा रत्नं राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशनम् । वराभरणनिर्ह्रादैः समुद्रस्वननिःस्वनम् ।।
data.es: Full of the jewels of joyous women, the residence of the lord of demons reverberated with the jingling of their ornaments and accessories like the sound of the sea.

data.v: तद्राजगुणसंपन्नं मुख्यैश्च वरचन्दनैः । भेरीमृदङ्गाभिरुतं शङ्खघोषविनादितम् ।।
data.es: The place was full of eminent demons with royal traits like a dense forest infested with lions. It carried the fragrance of agaru and sandal of good quality.

data.v: नित्यार्चितं पर्वहुतं पूजितं राक्षसैः सदा । समुद्रमिव गम्भीरं समुद्रमिव निःस्वनम् ।।
महात्मानो महद्वेश्म महारत्नपरिच्छदम् । महाजनसमाकीर्णं ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The place produced deep sounds like the sea. Those mighty ogres wore gemstudded ornaments. The great vanara saw the residence of the great self, Ravana rich with precious gems.

data.v: विराजमानं वपुषा गजाश्वरथसंकुलम् । लङ्काभरणमित्येव सोऽमन्यत महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the great monkey, saw the royal mansion looking brilliant with elephants, horses and chariots. He thought that the palace was the very ornament of Lanka. He moved unnoticed into the close quarters of Ravana.

data.v: गृहाद्गृहं राक्षसानामुद्यानानि च वानरः । वीक्षमाणो ह्यसंत्रस्तः प्रासादांश्च चचार सः ।।
data.es: Hanuman ranged undaunted from one mansion to another including the pleasure gardens.

data.v: अवप्लुत्य महावेगः प्रहस्तस्य निवेशनम् । ततोऽन्यत्पुप्लुवे वेश्म महापार्श्वस्य वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Courageous and swift, Hanuman sprang from Prahasta's house to Mahaparshva's, and so on.

data.v: अथ मेघप्रतीकाशं कुम्भकर्णनिवेशनम् । विभीषणस्य च तथा पुप्लुवे स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Then the great vanara leaped from the residence of Kumbhakarna which looked like a cloud to Vibhishana's.

data.v: महोदरस्य च तथा विरूपाक्षस्य चैव हि । विद्युज्जिह्वस्य भवनं विद्युन्मालेस्तथैव च । वज्रदंष्ट्रस्य च तथा पुप्लुवे स महाकपिः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जभजत], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरसज], अज्ञातम् [१२: जयतस], अज्ञातम् [१२: नतभर]

data.es: The great vanara leaped from Mahodara's to Virupaksha's, from Vidyujjihva's to Vidyunmali and then to Vajradanstra's.

data.v: शुकस्य च महावेगः सारणस्य च धीमतः । तथा चेन्द्रजितो वेश्म जगाम हरियूथपः ।।
data.es: The brilliant leader of monkeys bounded to the house of Suka, to the clever Sarana's and to Indrajit's.

data.v: जम्बुमालेः सुमालेश्च जगाम हरियूथपः । रश्मिकेतोश्च भवनं सूर्यशत्रोस्तथैव च ।।
data.es: The noble vanara jumped from Jambumali's to Sumali's and from Rashmiketu's, Suryaketu's and to Vajrakaya's residence.

data.v: धूम्राक्षस्य च संपातेर्भवनं मारुतात्मजः । विद्युद्रूपस्य भीमस्य घनस्य विघनस्य च ।।
शुकनाभस्य वक्रस्य शठस्य विकटस्य च । ह्रस्वकर्णस्य दंष्ट्रस्य रोमशस्य च रक्षसः ।।
युद्धोन्मत्तस्य मत्तस्य ध्वजग्रीवस्य नादिनः । विद्युज्जिह्वेन्द्रजिह्वानां तथा हस्तिमुखस्य च ।।
करालस्य पिशाचस्य शोणिताक्षस्य चैव हि । क्रममाणः क्रमेणैव हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
तेषु तेषु महार्हेषु भवनेषु महायशाः । तेषामृद्धिमतामृद्धिं ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The illustrious son of the Windgod jumped from house to house in an order and saw the wealth of the wealthy in the lofty mansions.

data.v: सर्वेषां समतिक्रम्य भवनानि समन्ततः । आससादाथ लक्ष्मीवान्राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशनम् ।।
data.es: Passing all the mansions, the lucky Hanuman reached the residence of the demon king, Ravana.

data.v: रावणस्योपशायिन्यो ददर्श हरिसत्तमः । विचरन्हरिशार्दूलो राक्षसीर्विकृतेक्षणाः । शूलमुद्गरहस्ताश्च शक्तो तोमरधारिणीः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जभभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: ययभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररतभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयज]

data.es: The heroic and powerful vanara saw at Ravana's residence demonesses with hideous eyes guarding the bed and an army of demons holding tridents, hammers, powerful javelins and iron cudgels.

data.v: ददर्श विविधान्गुल्मांस्तस्य रक्षःपतेर्गृहे ।।
data.es: At his (Ravana's) residence, Hanuman also noticed troops of huge demons ready with different kinds of weapons.

data.v: रक्ताञ्श्वेतान्सितांश्चैव हरींश्चैव महाजवान् । कुलीनान्रूपसंपन्नान्गजान्परगजारुजान् ।।
निष्ठितान्गजशिखायामैरावतसमान्युधि । निहन्तॄन्परसैन्यानां गृहे तस्मिन्ददर्श सः ।।
क्षरतश्च यथा मेघान्स्रवतश्च यथा गिरीन् । मेघस्तनितनिर्घोषान्दुर्धर्षान्समरे परैः ।।

data.es: Hanuman saw in the centre of that palace a complex of many wellbuilt houses.

data.es: It had latticed windows made of gold inlaid with crystals. The platforms were encrusted with saphires called Indraneela and Mahaneela appropriately.

data.v: तत्रस्थः स तदा गन्धं पानभक्ष्यान्नसंभवम् । दिव्यं संमूर्छितं जिघ्रन्रूपवन्तमिवानिलम् ।।
data.es: There he smelt the stupefying, unearthly odour of food and drink. He felt as though the fragrance had taken a potentially solid form.(Note: The wind has no form. But when he carried the aroma of food and drink it appeared like the personification of wind which could be smelt. गन्धवती पृथवी fragrance comes from earth पृथवीतत्त्व the poet transmits the same to the wind who has got only स्पर्श sense of touch).

data.v: स गन्धस्तं महासत्त्वं बन्धुर्बन्धुमिवोत्तमम् । इत एहीत्युवाचेव तत्र यत्र स रावणः ।।
data.es: The fragrance was as if inviting the mighty hero like a relative inviting his kith and kin, saying 'come here' and leading him to a place where Ravana rested.

data.v: ततस्तां प्रस्थितः शालां ददर्श महतीं शुभाम् । रावणस्य मनःकान्तां कान्तामिव वरस्त्रियम् ।।
data.es: Then he proceeded to an auspicious hall, which was Ravana's favourite like his chief queen dear to his heart.

data.v: मणिसोपानविकृतां हेमजालविराजिताम् । स्फाटिकैरावृततलां दन्तान्तरितरूपिकाम् ।।
data.es: The stairways of the mansion were inlaid with special gems, windows were latticed with gold, floors were covered with crystals, figures of ivory with silver.

data.es: It was decorated with pillars of silver and gold inlaid with pearls and corals and gems.

data.v: समैरृजुभिरत्युच्चैः समन्तात्सुविभूषितैः । स्तम्भैः पक्षैरिवात्युच्चैर्दिवं संप्रस्थितामिव ।।
data.es: It had highly ornamented pillars all over, some slightly bent and others straight. With lofty columns looking like wings it appeared as if the mansion had started on its journey to heaven.

data.v: अथारोहणमासाद्य वेदिकान्तरमाश्रितः । सुप्तं राक्षसशार्दूलं प्रेक्षते स्म महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The great vanara ascended the stairway and reached another altar and once again looked at the sleeping Ravana, the tiger among demons.

data.v: शुशुभे राक्षसेन्द्रस्य स्वपतः शयनोत्तमम् । गन्धहस्तिनि संविष्टे यथाप्रस्रवणं महत् ।।
data.es: While the lord of demons lay asleep on the magnificent couch, he looked like the Prasravana hill with its elephant in rut.

data.v: काञ्चनाङ्गदनद्धौ च ददर्श स महात्मनः । विक्षिप्तौ राक्षसेन्द्रस्य भुजाविन्द्रध्वजोपमौ ।।
ऐरावतविषाणाग्रैरापीडितकृतव्रणौ । वज्रोल्लिखितपीनांसौ विष्णुचक्रपरिक्षितौ ।।
पीनौ समसुजातांसौ संगतौ बलसंयुतौ । सुलक्षण नखाङ्गुष्ठौ स्वङ्गुलीतललक्षितौ ।।
संहतौ परिघाकारौ वृत्तौ करिकरोपमौ । विक्षिप्तौ शयने शुभ्रे पञ्चशीर्षाविवोरगौ ।।
शशक्षतजकल्पेन सुशीतेन सुगन्धिना । चन्दनेन परार्ध्येन स्वनुलिप्तौ स्वलंकृतौ ।।
उत्तमस्त्रीविमृदितौ गन्धोत्तमनिषेवितौ । यक्षपन्नगगन्धर्वदेवदानवराविणौ ।।
ददर्श स कपिस्तस्य बाहू शयनसंस्थितौ । मन्दरस्यान्तरे सुप्तौ महार्ही रुषिताविव ।।
data.es: The vanara, gazed at the arms of Ravana placed on the couch that appeared like two angry snakes asleep in a cave on (the lap) of mount Mandara.

data.v: ताभ्यां स परिपूर्णाभ्यां भुजाभ्यां राक्षसाधिपः । शुशुभेऽचलसंकाशः शृङ्गाभ्यामिव मन्दरः ।।
data.es: The lord of demons looked splendid like a mountain with his long, fully developed arms. He appeared like Mandara mountain with two lofty peaks.

data.v: चूतपुंनागसुरभिर्बकुलोत्तमसंयुतः । मृष्टान्नरससंयुक्तः पानगन्धपुरःसरः ।।
data.es: The breath released from the huge mouth of that lion of demons carried the fragrance of mango and punnaga as well as excellent Bakula flowers. It exuded the aroma of rich and delicious food and different drink. It was as though pervading the whole chamber.

data.v: तस्य राक्षससिंहस्य निश्चक्राम मुखान्महान् । शयानस्य विनिःश्वासः पूरयन्निव तद्गृहम् ।।
data.es: The breath released from the huge mouth of that lion of demons carried the fragrance of mango and punnaga as well as excellent Bakula flowers. It exuded the aroma of rich and delicious food and different drink. It was as though pervading the whole chamber.

data.v: मुक्तामणिविचित्रेण काञ्चनेन विराजता । मुकुटेनापवृत्तेन कुण्डलोज्ज्वलिताननम् ।।
रक्तचन्दनदिग्धेन तथा हारेण शोभिता । पीनायतविशालेन वक्षसाभिविराजितम् ।।
पाण्डुरेणापविद्धेन क्षौमेण क्षतजेक्षणम् । महार्हेण सुसंवीतं पीतेनोत्तमवाससा ।।
माषराशिप्रतीकाशं निःश्वसन्तं भुजङ्गवत् । गाङ्गे महति तोयान्ते प्रसुतमिव कुञ्जरम् ।।
चतुर्भिः काञ्चनैर्दीपैर्दीप्यमानैश्चतुर्दिशम् । प्रकाशीकृतसर्वाङ्गं मेघं विद्युद्गणैरिव ।।
पादमूलगताश्चापि ददर्श सुमहात्मनः । पत्नीः स प्रियभार्यस्य तस्य रक्षःपतेर्गृहे ।।
data.es: The tiger among vanaras saw at the great Ravana's palace a drinking place where everything one desires was provided.

data.v: शशिप्रकाशवदना वरकुण्डलभूषिताः । अम्लानमाल्याभरणा ददर्श हरियूथपः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the leader of vanaras found the wives of Ravana, whose faces were bright as the Moon, adorned with beautiful earrings and fresh floral garlands.

data.v: नृत्तवादित्रकुशला राक्षसेन्द्रभुजाङ्कगाः । वराभरणधारिण्यो निषन्ना ददृशे कपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw the women there wearing fine jewellery, performing dances, playing musical instruments, and resting on the lap or leaning on the arms of the demon king.

data.v: वज्रवैदूर्यगर्भाणि श्रवणान्तेषु योषिताम् । ददर्श तापनीयानि कुण्डलान्यङ्गदानि च ।।
data.es: He noticed on the earlobes of the the women gold earrings decked with diamonds and vaidurya. They were wearing shining armlets of gold.

data.v: तासां चन्द्रोपमैर्वक्त्रैः शुभैर्ललितकुण्डलैः । विरराज विमानं तन्नभस्तारागणैरिव ।।
data.es: There the beautiful moonlike faces of women Illumined by the lovely earrings lay on the cot which looked resplendent like the sky lit up with hosts of stars.

data.v: मदव्यायामखिन्नास्ता राक्षसेन्द्रस्य योषितः । तेषु तेष्ववकाशेषु प्रसुप्तास्तनुमध्यमाः ।।
data.es: Exhausted by drinking and indulging in amorous sport, the consorts of Ravana slept here and there with their visible slender waists.

data.v: काचिद्वीणां परिष्वज्य प्रसुप्ता संप्रकाशते । महानदीप्रकीर्णेव नलिनी पोतमाश्रिता ।।
data.es: Another woman slept hugging her veena. She shone like a lotus plant flung in a large river, clinging on to a boat. (Veena is compared to a boat and the woman to a lotusplant in the ambience of flowing waters of the river. The entire hall had put up such a dynamic view showing hectic life of the inmates).

data.v: अन्या कक्षगतेनैव मड्डुकेनासितेक्षणा । प्रसुप्ता भामिनी भाति बालपुत्रेव वत्सला ।।
data.es: A woman with dark eyes asleep with a drum placed in her armpit looked like a beautiful mother holding her loving baby (the drum was hung to her arm with a rope).

data.v: पटहं चारुसर्वाङ्गी पीड्य शेते शुभस्तनी । चिरस्य रमणं लब्ध्वा परिष्वज्येव कामिनी ।।
data.es: Another charming beauty endowed with beautiful breasts lay hugging a tambourine as though a passionate woman lay embracing her lover whom she secured after a long time.

data.v: काचिदंशं परिष्वज्य सुप्ता कमललोचना । निद्रावशमनुप्राप्ता सहकान्तेव भामिनी ।।
data.es: Yet another lotuseyed lady slept embracing a lute as if a lovelorn woman lay clasping her lover.

data.v: अन्या कनकसंकाशैर्मृदुपीनैर्मनोरमैः । मृदङ्गं परिपीड्याङ्गैः प्रसुप्ता मत्तलोचना ।।
data.es: Another lady with drunken eyes lay fast asleep holding a drum close to her beautiful bosom with her soft limbs. (These images show that these women were singing and dancing till late night and slept exhausted).

data.v: भुजपार्श्वान्तरस्थेन कक्षगेण कृशोदरी । पणवेन सहानिन्द्या सुप्ता मदकृतश्रमा ।।
data.es: Another lady of slender belly, who had been exhausted by drunkeness was lying with a tabor pressed to her bosom and inserted in her armpit.

data.v: डिण्डिमं परिगृह्यान्या तथैवासक्तडिण्डिमा । प्रसुप्ता तरुणं वत्समुपगूह्येव भामिनी ।।
data.es: One lovely woman and another held a drum and slept as if they were hugging their young child.

data.v: काचिदाडम्बरं नारी भुजसंभोगपीडितम् । कृत्वा कमलपत्राक्षी प्रसुप्ता मदमोहिता ।।
data.es: Yet another with her eyes like lotus petals deluded with passion tightly held in her arms a musical instrument known as Adambaram and slept.

data.v: कलशीमपविद्ध्यान्या प्रसुप्ता भाति भामिनी । वसन्ते पुष्पशबला मालेव परिमार्जिता ।।
data.es: Another lovely lady was fast asleep, having turned a goblet of water aside, yet another lay like a garland of variegated flowers in spring season.

data.v: पाणिभ्यां च कुचौ काचित्सुवर्णकलशोपमौ । उपगूह्याबला सुप्ता निद्राबलपराजिता ।।
data.es: Overcome with sleep another woman lay pressing with her own hands her golden gobletlike breasts.

data.v: अन्या कमलपत्राक्षी पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना । अन्यामालिङ्ग्य सुश्रोणी प्रसुप्ता मदविह्वला ।।
data.es: One woman with eyes like lotus petals and face like the fullmoon embraced another young woman of beautiful hips and slept tipsy with drink.

data.v: आतोद्यानि विचित्राणि परिष्वज्य वरस्त्रियः । निपीड्य च कुचैः सुप्ताः कामिन्यः कामुकानिव ।।
data.es: Some charming maidens held wonderful musical instruments pressing against their bosom and slept like passionate women embracing their loved ones.

data.v: तासामेकान्तविन्यस्ते शयानां शयने शुभे । ददर्श रूपसंपन्नामपरां स कपिः स्त्रियम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw some maidens lying on separate excellent beds, women richly endowed with beautysleeping.

data.v: मुक्तामणिसमायुक्तैर्भूषणैः सुविभूषिताम् । विभूषयन्तीमिव च स्वश्रिया भवनोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Then the vanara saw a very beautiful woman of golden complexion decked with pearls and gems and with ornaments as if illuminating the excellent mansion with her splendour She was the king's favourite and the chief queen, Mandodari.

data.v: गौरीं कनकवर्णाभामिष्टामन्तःपुरेश्वरीम् । कपिर्मन्दोदरीं तत्र शयानां चारुरूपिणीम् ।।
data.es: Then the vanara saw a very beautiful woman of golden complexion decked with pearls and gems and with ornaments as if illuminating the excellent mansion with her splendour She was the king's favourite and the chief queen, Mandodari.

data.v: स तां दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्भूषितां मारुतात्मजः । तर्कयामास सीतेति रूपयौवनसंपदा । हर्षेण महता युक्तो ननन्द हरियूथपः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यरमय], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरनर]

data.es: On seeing her embellished with ornaments, beauty and charm, the long armed son of the Windgod, the chief of the vanaras thought her to be Sita and rejoiced.

data.v: आस्फोटयामास चुचुम्ब पुच्छं; ननन्द चिक्रीड जगौ जगाम । स्तम्भानरोहन्निपपात भूमौ; निदर्शयन्स्वां प्रकृतिं कपीनाम् ।।
data.es: He rejoiced clapping his palms, kissing his tail and jumping up, climbing up the pillars and jumping down on the ground in joy. Thus he exhibited his monkey nature.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।Thus ends the tenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अवधूय च तां बुद्धिं बभूवावस्थितस्तदा । जगाम चापरां चिन्तां सीतां प्रति महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The great vanara, having rejected his judgement, started thinking again.

data.v: न रामेण वियुक्ता सा स्वप्तुमर्हति भामिनी । न भोक्तुं नाप्यलंकर्तुं न पानमुपसेवितुम् ।।
data.es: 'Lovely Sita, being away from Rama, will not sleep, will not eat or drink or adorn herself. How can she approach any other man even if he is the king of gods for there is none equal to Rama even among gods'. Having thus decided, Hanuman strolled about the banquet hall.

data.v: नान्यं नरमुपस्थातुं सुराणामपि चेश्वरम् । न हि रामसमः कश्चिद्विद्यते त्रिदशेष्वपि । अन्येयमिति निश्चित्य पानभूमौ चचार सः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जभभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: रससभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजतर]

data.es: 'Lovely Sita, being away from Rama, will not sleep, will not eat or drink or adorn herself. How can she approach any other man even if he is the king of gods for there is none equal to Rama even among gods'. Having thus decided, Hanuman strolled about the banquet hall.

data.v: क्रीडितेनापराः क्लान्ता गीतेन च तथा पराः । नृत्तेन चापराः क्लान्ताः पानविप्रहतास्तथा ।।
data.es: Some women were fatigued after sporting, similarly some were exhausted after singing. Others were tired through dancing and some were worn out by continuous drinking.

data.v: मुरजेषु मृदङ्गेषु पीठिकासु च संस्थिताः । तथास्तरणमुख्य्येषु संविष्टाश्चापराः स्त्रियः ।।
data.es: Some women reclined on tabors, some on murajas, and some on drums and hassocks while some slept on excellent couches.

data.v: अङ्गनानां सहस्रेण भूषितेन विभूषणैः । रूपसंलापशीलेन युक्तगीतार्थभाषिणा ।।
data.es: The monkey leader saw thousands of beautiful women asleep after long dalliance. Some of them were adorned with ornaments, some were good at arguments and versed in the appreciation of songs, some were aware of the appropriate time and place and some were adept in right expressions.

data.v: देशकालाभियुक्तेन युक्तवाक्याभिधायिना । रताभिरतसंसुप्तं ददर्श हरियूथपः ।।
data.es: The monkey leader saw thousands of beautiful women asleep after long dalliance. Some of them were adorned with ornaments, some were good at arguments and versed in the appreciation of songs, some were aware of the appropriate time and place and some were adept in right expressions.

data.v: तासां मध्ये महाबाहुः शुशुभे राक्षसेश्वरः । गोष्ठे महति मुख्यानां गवां मध्ये यथा वृषः ।।
data.es: In the midst of these women the longarmed lord of demons shone like a (majestic) bull in a big cowshed.

data.v: स राक्षसेन्द्रः शुशुभे ताभिः परिवृतः स्वयम् । करेणुभिर्यथारण्यं परिकीर्णो महाद्विपः ।।
data.es: Surrounded by the women, the demon king shone like a proud elephant attended by many female elephants scattered in a dense forest.

data.v: सर्वकामैरुपेतां च पानभूमिं महात्मनः । ददर्श कपिशार्दूलस्तस्य रक्षःपतेर्गृहे ।।
data.es: The tiger among vanaras saw at the great Ravana's palace a drinking place where everything one desires was provided.

data.v: मृगाणां महिषाणां च वराहाणां च भागशः । तत्र न्यस्तानि मांसानि पानभूमौ ददर्श सः ।।
data.es: There at the drinking hall the meat of deer, buffaloes and boars portioned and placed.

data.v: रौक्मेषु च विशलेषु भाजनेष्वर्धभक्षितान् । ददर्श कपिशार्दूल मयूरान्कुक्कुटांस्तथा ।।
data.es: The tiger among vanaras also saw there meat of peacocks and chicken placed in large golden vessels, some half eaten.

data.v: वराहवार्ध्राणसकान्दधिसौवर्चलायुतान् । शल्यान्मृगमयूरांश्च हनूमानन्ववैक्षत ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw the meat of pigs and jungle fowls, deer, peacocks and bones marinated with yoghurt and special kinds of salt.

data.v: कृकरान्विविधान्सिद्धांश्चकोरानर्धभक्षितान् । महिषानेकशल्यांश्च छागांश्च कृतनिष्ठितान् । लेख्यमुच्चावचं पेयं भोज्यानि विविधानि च ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: ससतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसयय], अज्ञातम् [१२: जभतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यमनभ]

data.es: He saw several kinds of (nonvegetarian) food like cooked meat of fowls, ruddy geese, buffaloes, goats, fishes as well as food for licking. (Food is of four kinds 1) भक्ष्य which can be chewed 2) भोज्य ordinary solid, semisolid food which can be consumed 3) लेह्य food for licking 4) चोष्य liquid food (which can be sipped)).

data.v: तथाम्ललवणोत्तंसैर्विविधै रागषाडवैः । हार नूपुरकेयूरैरपविद्धैर्महाधनैः ।।
data.es: The banquet hall looked splendid with food seasoned with salt and sour ingredients. There was ragashadavas (syrup made with grapes, pomegranates, different juices like half ripe mangoes and seasoned with ginger cardomom, butter etc). Heavy chains, anklets and shouldersstraps were thrown aside. (The people relaxed while eating and drinking and discarded heavy ornaments). Many glasses were found scattered or drinks spilt on the floor after use.Many fruits and flowers were kept.

data.v: पानभाजनविक्षिप्तैः फलैश्च विविधैरपि । कृतपुष्पोपहारा भूरधिकं पुष्यति श्रियम् ।।
data.es: The banquet hall looked splendid with food seasoned with salt and sour ingredients. There was ragashadavas (syrup made with grapes, pomegranates, different juices like half ripe mangoes and seasoned with ginger cardomom, butter etc). Heavy chains, anklets and shouldersstraps were thrown aside. (The people relaxed while eating and drinking and discarded heavy ornaments). Many glasses were found scattered or drinks spilt on the floor after use.Many fruits and flowers were kept.

data.es: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, came out of the aerial chariot, mind stricken with grief and started thinking again.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: विमानात्तु सुसंक्रम्य प्राकारं हरियूथपः । हनूमान्वेगवानासीद्यथा विद्युद्घनान्तरे ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the vanara leader, jumped from the aerial chariot to the boundary wall like a flash of lightning in the clouds.

data.v: संपरिक्रम्य हनुमान्रावणस्य निवेशनान् । अदृष्ट्वा जानकीं सीतामब्रवीद्वचनं कपिः ।।
data.es: Going round the palace of Ravana, unable to see Janaka's daughter Sita, Hanuman spoke thus to himself:

data.v: भूयिष्ठं लोडिता लङ्का रामस्य चरता प्रियम् । न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं सीतां सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम् ।।
data.es: "I have thoroughly surveyed the entire city of Lanka to please Rama, but I am unable to find Sita of flawless beauty.

data.v: पल्वलानि तटाकानि सरांसि सरितस्तथा । नद्योऽनूपवनान्ताश्च दुर्गाश्च धरणीधराः । लोडिता वसुधा सर्वा न च पश्यामि जानकीम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यभतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसभभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसयज]

data.es: "I have searched for Sita thoroughly in waterlogs, lakes, tanks, streams and rivers and all over the woods and among mountains that are difficult to reach. I have searched all over the land but have not been able to find Janaki.

data.v: इह संपातिना सीता रावणस्य निवेशने । आख्याता गृध्रराजेन न च पश्यामि तामहम् ।।
data.es: "Sampati, king of vultures had said that Sita is at Ravana's palace. But I have not been able to see her.

data.v: किं नु सीताथ वैदेही मैथिली जनकात्मजा । उपतिष्ठेत विवशा रावणं दुष्टचारिणम् ।।
data.es: "Can it be that Mythili, daughter of Janaka, dejected and helpless succumbed to the evil intentions of Ravana.

data.v: क्षिप्रमुत्पततो मन्ये सीतामादाय रक्षसः । बिभ्यतो रामबाणानामन्तरा पतिता भवेत् ।।
data.es: "Or, perhaps she might have been dropped midway from the hold of Ravana while he was flying at great speed, afraid of the deadly arrows of Rama?

data.v: अथ वा ह्रियमाणायाः पथि सिद्धनिषेविते । मन्ये पतितमार्याया हृदयं प्रेक्ष्य सागरम् ।।
data.es: "Or, perhaps while being borne away on the path frequented by siddhas, the beloved of Rama might have fallen down (dead), heart broken, on seeing the (vast) sea.

data.v: रावणस्योरुवेगेन भुजाभ्यां पीडितेन च । तया मन्ये विशालाक्ष्या त्यक्तं जीवितमार्यया ।।
data.es: "He thinks, on account of the high speed during the flight of Ravana under the pressure of his arms, the noble, largeeyed lady might have given up her life.

data.v: उपर्युपरि वा नूनं सागरं क्रमतस्तदा । विवेष्टमाना पतिता समुद्रे जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: "Surely, she might have fallen into the sea while wriggling in her effort to extricate herself from the hold of Ravana as he was flying over the sea.

data.v: आहो क्षुद्रेण चानेन रक्षन्ती शीलमात्मनः । अबन्धुर्भक्षिता सीता रावणेन तपस्विनी ।।
data.es: "Oh poor Sita, distanced from relations, while protecting her chastity helplessly she might have been devoured by cruel Ravana.

data.v: अथ वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पत्नीभिरसितेक्षणा । अदुष्टा दुष्टभावाभिर्भक्षिता सा भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Or else, the pious, blackeyed Sita might have been eaten by the the cruelnatured wives of the lord of demons.

data.v: संपूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् । रामस्य ध्यायती वक्त्रं पञ्चत्वं कृपणा गता ।।
data.es: "Or, she might have attained death, meditating on Rama, whose face resembles the fullmoon and eyes the lotus petals.

data.v: हा राम लक्ष्मणेत्येव हायोध्येति च मैथिली । विलप्य बहु वैदेही न्यस्तदेहा भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Or, Vaidehi, the princess of Mithila might have cast off her life grieving intensely and crying, 'Alas, Rama, alas, Lakshmana, alas, Ayodhya'. (Mithila is the name of the capital city and Videha is the country which was ruled by Janaka. Sita, the princess is known as Vaidehi, Mythili and Janaki).

data.v: अथ वा निहिता मन्ये रावणस्य निवेशने । नूनं लालप्यते मन्दं पञ्जरस्थेव शारिका ।।
data.es: "Or, I think Sita might have been imprisoned in a cage like a myna in Ravana's palace. She will be surely crying.

data.v: जनकस्य कुले जाता रामपत्नी सुमध्यमा । कथमुत्पलपत्राक्षी रावणस्य वशं व्रजेत् ।।
data.es: "How could Janaki, the daughter of Janaka, Rama's wife, the lady with a beautiful waist and eyes like lotus petals, come under the fold of Ravana?

data.v: विनष्टा वा प्रनष्टा वा मृता वा जनकात्मजा । रामस्य प्रियभार्यस्य न निवेदयितुं क्षमम् ।।
data.es: "Whether Janaki is lost or irretrievable or dead is not known The news should not be reported to Rama, who is very fond of his wife.

data.v: निवेद्यमाने दोषः स्याद्दोषः स्यादनिवेदने । कथं नु खलु कर्तव्यं विषमं प्रतिभाति मे ।।
data.es: "To carry or not to carry this news to Rama would be a mistake. What shall I do? I am facing a tough situation.

data.v: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कर्ये प्राप्तकालं क्षमं च किम् । भवेदिति मतिं भूयो हनुमान्प्रविचारयन् ।।
data.es: "I wonder what the right course of action is when things have taken such a turn? What is proper for me to do? Hanuman once again deliberated.

data.v: यदि सीतामदृष्ट्वाहं वानरेन्द्रपुरीमितः । गमिष्यामि ततः को मे पुरुषार्थो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "If I return to Kishkinda without seeing Sita of what use is my effort? What have I accomplished? What will happen? (Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha are the four Purusharthas or accomplishments in life)

data.v: ममेदं लङ्घनं व्यर्थं सागरस्य भविष्यति । प्रवेशश्चिव लङ्काया राक्षसानां च दर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "My crossing the ocean, my entry into Lanka and my survey of the demons are all futile.

data.v: किं वा वक्ष्यति सुग्रीवो हरयो व समागताः । किष्किन्धां समनुप्राप्तौ तौ वा दशरथात्मजौ ।।
data.es: "What will Sugriva or even the vanaras and the two sons of Dasaratha say when I reach Kishkinda?

data.v: गत्वा तु यदि काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि परमप्रियम् । न दृष्टेति मया सीता ततस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "If I report the most unpleasant news that Sita was not found, Rama will give up his life.

data.v: परुषं दारुणं क्रूरं तीक्ष्णमिन्द्रियतापनम् । सीतानिमित्तं दुर्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा स न भविष्यति ।।
तं तु कृच्छ्रगतं दृष्ट्वा पञ्चत्वगतमानसं । भृशानुरक्तो मेधावी न भविष्यति लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: "Seeing Rama in such a painful state, wise Lakshmana who has given his life to Rama, to whom he is deeply devoted will also not survive.

data.v: विनष्टौ भ्रातरौ श्रुत्वा भरतोऽपि मरिष्यति । भरतं च मृतं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुघ्नो न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "On hearing the death of both the brothers Bharata will also die. On seeing this Satrughna will also not live.

data.v: पुत्रान्मृतान्समीक्ष्याथ न भविष्यन्ति मातरः । कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च कैकेयी च न संशयः ।।
कृतज्ञः सत्यसंधश्च सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । रामं तथा गतं दृष्ट्वा ततस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "On seeing that Rama has ended his life, the grateful and truthful monkey leader, Sugriva will give up his life.

data.v: दुर्मना व्यथिता दीना निरानन्दा तपस्विनी । पीडिता भर्तृशोकेन रुमा त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "Distressed, disheartened, pained and grieved on account of her husband's death, the virtuous lady Ruma (wife of Sugriva) will be unhappy and die.

data.v: वालिजेन तु दुःखेन पीडिता शोककर्शिता । पञ्चत्वगमने राज्ञस्तारापि न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Tara who is troubled by Vali's death and tortured with grief will not live when king Sugriva dies.

data.v: मातापित्रोर्विनाशेन सुग्रीव व्यसनेन च । कुमारोऽप्यङ्गदः कस्माद्धारयिष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "On account of his parents death and also because of Sugriva's calamity, Angada will give up his life.

data.v: भर्तृजेन तु शोकेन अभिभूता वनौकसः । शिरांस्यभिहनिष्यन्ति तलैर्मुष्टिभिरेव च ।।
data.es: "The grief due to the death of their king will make the vanaras hit their heads with their palms and fists.

data.v: सान्त्वेनानुप्रदानेन मानेन च यशस्विना । लालिताः कपिराजेन प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति वानराः ।।
data.es: "The vanaras who were reared by the king's kind words, gifts and care will give up their life.

data.v: न वनेषु न शैलेषु न निरोधेषु वा पुनः । क्रीडामनुभविष्यन्ति समेत्य कपिकुञ्जराः ।।
data.es: "The chiefs among vanaras together will not enjoy their life in the forest or mountains or caves.

data.v: सपुत्रदाराः सामात्या भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः । शैलाग्रेभ्यः पतिष्यन्ति समेत्य विषमेषु च ।।
data.es: "Tormented by their king's death the vanaras with their wives, sons and ministers will drop down from the mountain peaks on the rough ground and die.

data.v: विषमुद्बन्धनं वापि प्रवेशं ज्वलनस्य वा । उपवासमथो शस्त्रं प्रचरिष्यन्ति वानराः ।।
data.es: "The vanaras will put an end to their lives by poisoning or by hanging or by selfimmolation or by killing themselves with weapons or by fasting unto death.

data.v: घोरमारोदनं मन्ये गते मयि भविष्यति । इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च नाशश्चैव वनौकसाम् ।।
data.es: "If I go there (without finding Sita), it will cause destruction of the Ikshvakus and vanaras would weep. It would be dreadful.

data.v: सोऽहं नैव गमिष्यामि किष्किन्धां नगरीमितः । न हि शक्ष्याम्यहं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं मैथिलीं विना ।।
data.es: "I will not go to the city of Kishkinda from here or to Sugriva without finding Mythili. It will not be possible for me to face him.

data.v: मय्यगच्छति चेहस्थे धर्मात्मानौ महारथौ । आशया तौ धरिष्येते वनराश्च मनस्विनः ।।
data.es: Both the highsouled warrior princes treading a righteous path as well as the vanaras will survive with a hope of my return if I stay back.

data.v: हस्तादानो मुखादानो नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः । वानप्रस्थो भविष्यामि अदृष्ट्वा जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: "If Janaki is not found I will stay here and live like a hermit subsisting on whatever is available on this sea shore, which has abundance of roots, fruits and water.

data.v: सागरानूपजे देशे बहुमूलफलोदके । चितां कृत्वा प्रवेक्ष्यामि समिद्धमरणीसुतम् ।।
उपविष्टस्य वा सम्यग्लिङ्गिनं साधयिष्यतः । शरीरं भक्षयिष्यन्ति वायसाः श्वापदानि च ।।
data.es: "I will prepare a pyre and enter the fire so that sea waves wash off the ashes or crows and beasts will eat up my body while i sit fasting unto death.

data.v: इदमप्यृषिभिर्दृष्टं निर्याणमिति मे मतिः । सम्यगापः प्रवेक्ष्यामि न चेत्पश्यामि जानकीम् ।।
data.es: "I shall enter water and drown myself to death if I am not able to find Janaki. I think this way of ending life has been suggested by great ascetics.

data.v: सुजातमूला सुभगा कीर्तिमालायशस्विनी । प्रभग्ना चिररात्रीयं मम सीतामपश्यतः ।।
data.es: My glory which had a good start (in the form of bringing Rama to Sugriva) and brought fortune to Sugriva and fame to me has been snapped as I could not find Sita.

data.v: तापसो वा भविष्यामि नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः । नेतः प्रतिगमिष्यामि तामदृष्ट्वासितेक्षणाम् ।।
data.es: "I will remain an ascetic and do penance under the tree practising selfcontrol and not go back without seeing the blackeyed Sita.

data.v: यदीतः प्रतिगच्छामि सीतामनधिगम्य ताम् । अङ्गदः सहितैः सर्वैर्वानरैर्न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Besides, if I go back without finding Sita all the vanaras including Angada will die.

data.v: विनाशे बहवो दोषा जीवन्प्राप्नोति भद्रकम् । तस्मात्प्राणान्धरिष्यामि ध्रुवो जीवति संगमः ।।
data.es: "If I commit suicide, I will earn numerous sins. By being alive, I can witness auspicious events. Therefore, I will live, for, happiness can come only to the living.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं दुःखं मनसा धारयन्मुहुः । नाध्यगच्छत्तदा पारं शोकस्य कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
data.es: The elephant among monkeys (Hanuman) worrying over and over again, holding his head for long could not reach the end of his grief.

data.v: रावणं वा वधिष्यामि दशग्रीवं महाबलम् । काममस्तु हृता सीता प्रत्याचीर्णं भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "I will kill Ravana, this mighty, tenheaded demon. Sita was indeed carried away by him. This (killing him) can be a fitting reply to his evil action. My desire would be fulfilled.

data.v: अथ वैनं समुत्क्षिप्य उपर्युपरि सागरम् । रामायोपहरिष्यामि पशुं पशुपतेरिव ।।
data.es: "Or else, I shall carry him across the sea and put him before Rama like a bull as if he is a sacrificial prey to lord Siva."

data.v: इति चिन्ता समापन्नः सीतामनधिगम्य ताम् । ध्यानशोका परीतात्मा चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Distressed over his inability to find Sita, Hanuman's mind was overcome with anxiety and he started thinking further.

data.v: यावत्सीतां न पश्यामि रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम् । तावदेतां पुरीं लङ्कां विचिनोमि पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: "Till I find the virtuous Sita, wife of Rama in this Lanka, I shall keep searching everywhere again and again.

data.v: संपाति वचनाच्चापि रामं यद्यानयाम्यहम् । अपश्यन्राघवो भार्यां निर्दहेत्सर्ववानरान् ।।
data.es: "Had I brought Raghava following the words of Sampati, Rama would have burnt all vanaras unable to find his wife.

data.v: इहैव नियताहारो वत्स्यामि नियतेन्द्रियः । न मत्कृते विनश्येयुः सर्वे ते नरवानराः ।।
data.es: "I will stay here itself, restricting my food and controlling my senses. Let not men and monkeys perish for my fault.

data.v: अशोकवनिका चापि महतीयं महाद्रुमा । इमामभिगमिष्यामि न हीयं विचिता मया ।।
data.es: "Here is the Ashoka grove with huge trees. I will go there. I have not looked for her in this place.

data.v: वसून्रुद्रांस्तथादित्यानश्विनौ मरुतोऽपि च । नमस्कृत्वा गमिष्यामि रक्षसां शोकवर्धनः ।।
data.es: "I shall offer salutations to Vasus, Rudras Adityas and Aswinis and proceed to increase (cause) the sorrow of the demons. (There are eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas, two Ashwins and fortynine Windgods).

data.v: जित्वा तु राक्षसान्देवीमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम् । संप्रदास्यामि रामाया यथासिद्धिं तपस्विने ।।
data.es: "I will conquer all the ogres and pass them to Sita, the delight of the Ikshvaku family as an offering and give Rama to her as the fruit of her austerities."

data.v: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा चिन्ताविग्रथितेन्द्रियः । उदतिष्ठन्महाबाहुर्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The brilliant son of the Windgod, Hanuman, whose senses were overwhelmed with worries, regained his senses in a short while and got up.

data.v: नमोऽस्तु रामाय सलक्ष्मणाय; देव्यै च तस्यै जनकात्मजायै । नमोऽस्तु रुद्रेन्द्रयमानिलेभ्यो; नमोऽस्तु चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः ।।
data.es: "My salutations to Lakshmana, Rama and divine daughter of Janaka. Salutations to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu. Salutations to Sun, Moon and Maruts"

data.v: स तेभ्यस्तु नमस्कृत्वा सुग्रीवाय च मारुतिः । दिशः सर्वाः समालोक्य अशोकवनिकां प्रति ।।
data.es: Having offered salutations to all gods as well as to Sugriva, he looked at all quarters and left for the Ashoka grove.

data.v: स गत्वा मनसा पूर्वमशोकवनिकां शुभाम् । उत्तरं चिन्तयामास वानरो मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Hanuman started thinking again about his task after reaching the auspicious Ashoka grove.

data.v: ध्रुवं तु रक्षोबहुला भविष्यति वनाकुला । अशोकवनिका चिन्त्या सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता ।।
data.es: 'This Ashoka grove filled with many trees, guarded by many demons is carefully tended. It must be sacred.

data.v: रक्षिणश्चात्र विहिता नूनं रक्षन्ति पादपान् । भगवानपि सर्वात्मा नातिक्षोभं प्रवायति ।।
data.es: "The guards posted there are surely protecting the grove. The divinity pervading all over me (the wind) must also have been controlled as it is also not blowing violently. I have turned my body small for Rama's cause and also to save myself from Ravana.

data.v: संक्षिप्तोऽयं मयात्मा च रामार्थे रावणस्य च । सिद्धिं मे संविधास्यन्ति देवाः सर्षिगणास्त्विह ।।
ब्रह्मा स्वयम्भूर्भगवान्देवाश्चैव दिशन्तु मे । सिद्धिमग्निश्च वायुश्च पुरुहूतश्च वज्रधृत् ।।
वरुणः पाशहस्तश्च सोमादित्यै तथैव च । अश्विनौ च महात्मानौ मरुतः सर्व एव च ।।
सिद्धिं सर्वाणि भूतानि भूतानां चैव यः प्रभुः । दास्यन्ति मम ये चान्ये अदृष्टाः पथि गोचराः ।।
तदुन्नसं पाण्डुरदन्तमव्रणं; शुचिस्मितं पद्मपलाशलोचनम् । द्रक्ष्ये तदार्यावदनं कदा न्वहं; प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: 'Oh when and how would I behold that beautiful noble lady of stainless character, with a Moonlike face, prominent nose, white teeth, pleasant smile and with eyes like lotus petals?

data.v: क्षुद्रेण पापेन नृशंसकर्मणा; सुदारुणालांकृतवेषधारिणा । बलाभिभूता अबला तपस्विनी; कथं नु मे दृष्टपथेऽद्य सा भवेत् ।।
data.es: "How will I set my eyes on that gentle, frail and suffering thing now, who has been abducted by that mean, cruel sinner of dreadful look?"इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यत्वा मनसा चाधिगम्य ताम् । अवप्लुतो महातेजाः प्राकारं तस्य वेश्मनः ।।
data.es: Mighty Hanuman lost in thought for a moment, jumped down (the harem) to the boundary wall of the palace.

data.v: स तु संहृष्टसर्वाङ्गः प्राकारस्थो महाकपिः । पुष्पिताग्रान्वसन्तादौ ददर्श विविधान्द्रुमान् ।।
data.es: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.

data.v: सालानशोकान्भव्यांश्च चम्पकांश्च सुपुष्पितान् । उद्दालकान्नागवृक्षांश्चूतान्कपिमुखानपि ।।
data.es: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.

data.v: अथाम्रवणसंछन्नां लताशतसमावृताम् । ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचः पुप्लुवे वृक्षवाटिकाम् ।।
data.es: He penetrated like an arrow released from a bow the cluster of trees covering mango grove and overgrown with hundreds of creepers.

data.v: स प्रविष्य विचित्रां तां विहगैरभिनादिताम् । राजतैः काञ्चनैश्चैव पादपैः सर्वतोवृताम् ।।
विहगैर्मृगसंघैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम् । उदितादित्यसंकाशां ददर्श हनुमान्कपिः ।।
वृतां नानाविधैर्वृक्षैः पुष्पोपगफलोपगैः । कोकिलैर्भृङ्गराजैश्च मत्तैर्नित्यनिषेविताम् ।।
प्रहृष्टमनुजे कले मृगपक्षिसमाकुले । मत्तबर्हिणसंघुष्टां नानाद्विजगणायुताम् ।।
मार्गमाणो वरारोहां राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम् । सुखप्रसुप्तान्विहगान्बोधयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: The vanara who went searching for the paragon of virtue born of a noble family, awakened the birds who were happily asleep in their nests.

data.v: उत्पतद्भिर्द्विजगणैः पक्षैः सालाः समाहताः । अनेकवर्णा विविधा मुमुचुः पुष्पवृष्टयः ।।
data.es: As the birds flew away, the trees hit by the wings of birds showered flowers of different colours.

data.v: पुष्पावकीर्णः शुशुभे हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः । अशोकवनिकामध्ये यथा पुष्पमयो गिरिः ।।
data.es: Covered with flowers, Hanuman shone like a mountain of flowers in the midst of Ashoka grove.

data.v: दिशः सर्वाभिदावन्तं वृक्षषण्डगतं कपिम् । दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि वसन्त इति मेनिरे ।।
data.es: Beholding that sprightly monkey running in all directions, its body covered with variegated blossoms fallen from the trees, all living beings there thought that it was Spring personified

data.v: वृक्षेभ्यः पतितैः पुष्पैरवकीर्णा पृथग्विधैः । रराज वसुधा तत्र प्रमदेव विभूषिता ।।
data.es: Strewn with flowers of various colours fallen from the trees of various kinds, the goddess of earth looked charming like a young woman profusely bedecked.

data.v: तरस्विना ते तरवस्तरसाभिप्रकम्पिताः । कुसुमानि विचित्राणि ससृजुः कपिना तदा ।।
data.es: Shaken vigorously by Hanuman of great speed, the trees shed their blooms of variegated colours.

data.v: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः शीर्णपुष्पफलद्रुमाः । निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणा धूर्ता इव पराजिताः ।।
data.es: The tree tops, shorn of their leaves and flowers and fruits fallen, appeared like gamblers who had lost their stakes and had to lay down their clothes and ornaments.

data.v: हनूमता वेगवता कम्पितास्ते नगोत्तमाः । पुष्पपर्णफलान्याशु मुमुचुः पुष्पशालिनः ।।
data.es: Shaken by the swift Hanuman, even the big trees dropped flowers, fruits and leaves.

data.v: विहंगसंघैर्हीनास्ते स्कन्धमात्राश्रया द्रुमाः । बभूवुरगमाः सर्वे मारुतेनेव निर्धुताः ।।
data.es: Deserted by the flocks of birds resting on them (flowers and leaves also dropped from branches), the trees were left bare with trunks unable to move.

data.v: विधूतकेशी युवतिर्यथा मृदितवर्णिका । निष्पीतशुभदन्तौष्ठी नखैर्दन्तैश्च विक्षता ।।
data.es: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail, hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).

data.v: तथा लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च चरणाभ्यां च मर्दिता । बभूवाशोकवनिका प्रभग्नवरपादपा ।।
data.es: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail, hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).

data.v: महालतानां दामानि व्यधमत्तरसा कपिः । यथा प्रावृषि विन्ध्यस्य मेघजालानि मारुतः ।।
data.es: Hanuman shook with tremendous speed the huge clusters of creepers hanging there just like stormy wind in rainy season scatters masses of clouds on the Vindhya mountain.

data.v: स तत्र मणिभूमीश्च राजतीश्च मनोरमाः । तथा काञ्चनभूमीश्च विचरन्ददृशे कपिः ।।
data.es: Roaming there the monkey noticed the beautiful floors paved with gems, gold and silver৷৷

data.v: वापीश्च विविधाकाराः पूर्णाः परमवारिणा । महार्हैर्मणिसोपानैरुपपन्नास्ततस्ततः ।।
मुक्ताप्रवालसिकता स्फटिकान्तरकुट्टिमाः । काञ्चनैस्तरुभिश्चित्रैस्तीरजैरुपशोभिताः ।।
फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवनाश्चक्रवाकोपकूजिताः । नत्यूहरुतसंघुष्टा हंससारसनादिताः ।।
दीर्घाभिर्द्रुमयुक्ताभिः सरिद्भिश्च समन्ततः । अमृतोपमतोयाभिः शिवाभिरुपसंस्कृताः ।।
लताशतैरवतताः सन्तानकसमावृताः । नानागुल्मावृतवनाः करवीरकृतान्तराः ।।
ततोऽम्बुधरसंकाशं प्रवृद्धशिखरं गिरिम् । विचित्रकूटं कूटैश्च सर्वतः परिवारितम् ।।
data.es: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.

data.v: शिलागृहैरवततं नानावृक्षैः समावृतम् । ददर्श कपिशार्दूलो रम्यं जगति पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.

data.v: ददर्श च नगात्तस्मान्नदीं निपतितां कपिः । अङ्कादिव समुत्पत्य प्रियस्य पतितां प्रियाम् ।।
जले निपतिताग्रैश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम् । वार्यमाणामिव क्रुद्धां प्रमदां प्रियबन्धुभिः ।।
पुनरावृत्ततोयां च ददर्श स महाकपिः । प्रसन्नामिव कान्तस्य कान्तां पुनरुपस्थिताम् ।।
तस्यादूरात्स पद्मिन्यो नानाद्विजगणायुताः । ददर्श कपिशार्दूलो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The son of the Windgod, Hanuman, saw a huge, spacious and excellent of all mansions in the centre of the palace.

data.v: कृत्रिमां दीर्घिकां चापि पूर्णां शीतेन वारिणा । मणिप्रवरसोपानां मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank. Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.

data.v: विविधैर्मृगसंघैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम् । प्रासादैः सुमहद्भिश्च निर्मितैर्विश्वकर्मणा । काननैः कृत्रिमैश्चापि सर्वतः समलंकृताम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससभत]

data.es: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank. Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.

data.v: ये केचित्पादपास्तत्र पुष्पोपगफलोपगाः । सच्छत्राः सवितर्दीकाः सर्वे सौवर्णवेदिकाः ।।
data.es: There the trees had abundance of flowers and fruits. A few trees were full of leaves and branches spread like parasols. There were raised golden platforms.

data.v: लताप्रतानैर्बहुभिः पर्णैश्च बहुभिर्वृताम् । काञ्चनीं शिंशुपामेकां ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The monkey leader saw one simsupa tree covered all over with canopies of many climbers and leaves. The tree was surrounded by golden platforms.

data.v: सोऽपश्यद्भूमिभागांश्च गर्तप्रस्रवणानि च । सुवर्णवृक्षानपरान्ददर्श शिखिसंनिभान् ।।
data.es: He beheld several pieces of land and streams flowing out of the springs. He also noticed golden trees asresplendent as fire.

data.v: तेषां द्रुमाणां प्रभया मेरोरिव महाकपिः । अमन्यत तदा वीरः काञ्चनोऽस्मीति वानरः ।।
data.es: He saw trees resplendent with golden radiance and thought that he was in the midst of gold like the Sungod getting golden hue by the radiance of Meru, the golden mountain.

data.v: तां काञ्चनैस्तरुगणैर्मारुतेन च वीजिताम् । किङ्किणीशतनिर्घोषां दृष्ट्वा विस्मयमागमत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman was wonderstruck to hear the sound produced by rows of golden trees which stood round the simsupa tree. This sound resembled the tinkling of a hundred anklets when the wind passed through (their leaves).

data.v: सुपुष्पिताग्रां रुचिरां तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम् । तामारुह्य महावेगः शिंशपां पर्णसंवृताम् ।।
data.es: Strongarmed Hanuman climbed up the simsupa tree shining with flowers on its top and surrounded by tender sprouts and leaves. (He said to himself):

data.v: इतो द्रक्ष्यामि वैदेहीं राम दर्शनलालसाम् । इतश्चेतश्च दुःखार्तां संपतन्तीं यदृच्छया ।।
data.es: "I may see by chance( from this point) Vaidehi tormented with grief anxiously waiting to see Rama while moving about here and there casually.

data.v: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृढं रम्या दुरात्मनः । चम्पकैश्चन्दनैश्चापि बकुलैश्च विभूषिता ।।
data.es: "Surely this beautiful Ashoka grove with delightful champak, chandan and bakula trees belongs to the wicked Ravana."

data.v: इयं च नलिनी रम्या द्विजसंघनिषेविता । इमां सा राममहिषी नूनमेष्यति जानकी ।।
data.es: "This lovely lotuspond is frequented by flocks of aquatic birds. Surely Rama's queen Janaki will come to this place.

data.v: सा राम राममहिषी राघवस्य प्रिया सदा । वनसंचारकुशला नूनमेष्यति जानकी ।।
data.es: "Beautiful Janaki, beloved queen of Rama loves to wander in forests. She will surely visit this grove.

data.v: अथ वा मृगशावाक्षी वनस्यास्य विचक्षणा । वनमेष्यति सा चेह रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता ।।
data.es: "Or may be that doeeyed noble lady brooding over Rama will come to this garden she is familiar with.

data.v: रामशोकाभिसंतप्ता सा देवी वामलोचना । वनवासरता नित्यमेष्यते वनचारिणी ।।
data.es: "That lovelyeyed queen tormented with grief over separation from Rama will be coming here to stay as she always loves strolling in the forest.

data.v: वनेचराणां सततं नूनं स्पृहयते पुरा । रामस्य दयिता भार्या जनकस्य सुता सती ।।
data.es: "The daughter of Janaka, the chaste wife of Rama, used to for the company of those creatures wandering in the forest.

data.v: संध्याकालमनाः श्यामा ध्रुवमेष्यति जानकी । नदीं चेमां शिवजलां संध्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी ।।
data.es: Surely that lady of lovely complexion, the beautiful Janaki will come to this river flowing with sacred waters for performing the evening rituals.

data.v: तस्याश्चाप्यनुरूपेयमशोकवनिका शुभा । शुभा या पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य पत्नी रामस्य संमिता ।।
data.es: To the auspicious Sita,the beloved of Rama, the lord of the world, this Ashoka grove is a befitting place.

data.es: "The moonfaced queen will certainly come to this stream of auspicious water if she is surviving."

data.v: एवं तु मत्वा हनुमान्महात्मा; प्रतीक्षमाणो मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम् । अवेक्षमाणश्च ददर्श सर्वं; सुपुष्पिते पर्णघने निलीनः ।।
data.es: Pondering thus, the highsouled Hanuman remained concealed on the tree loaded with flowers and leaves and waited, looking eagerly for the wife of the lord of the people. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: स वीक्षमाणस्तत्रस्थो मार्गमाणश्च मैथिलीम् । अवेक्षमाणश्च महीं सर्वां तामन्ववैक्षत ।।

data.v: सन्तान कलताभिश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम् । दिव्यगन्धरसोपेतां सर्वतः समलंकृताम् ।।
तां स नन्दनसंकाशां मृगपक्षिभिरावृताम् । हर्म्यप्रासादसंबाधां कोकिलाकुलनिःस्वनाम् ।।
काञ्चनोत्पलपद्माभिर्वापीभिरुपशोभिताम् । बह्वासनकुथोपेतां बहुभूमिगृहायुताम् ।।
सर्वर्तुकुसुमै रम्यैः फलवद्भिश्च पादपैः । पुष्पितानामशोकानां श्रिया सूर्योदयप्रभाम् ।।
प्रदीप्तामिव तत्रस्थो मारुतिः समुदैक्षत । निष्पत्रशाखां विहगैः क्रियमाणामिवासकृत् । विनिष्पतद्भिः शतशश्चित्रैः पुष्पावतंसकैः ।।

कर्णिकारैः कुसुमितैः किंशुकैश्च सुपुष्पितैः । स देशः प्रभया तेषां प्रदीप्त इव सर्वतः ।।
पुंनागाः सप्तपर्णाश्च चम्पकोद्दालकास्तथा । विवृद्धमूला बहवः शोभन्ते स्म सुपुष्पिताः ।।

data.v: नन्दनं विविधोद्यानं चित्रं चैत्ररथं यथा । अतिवृत्तमिवाचिन्त्यं दिव्यं रम्यं श्रिया वृतम् ।।
द्वितीयमिव चाकाशं पुष्पज्योतिर्गणायुतम् । पुष्परत्नशतैश्चित्रं पञ्चमं सागरं यथा ।।
सर्वर्तुपुष्पैर्निचितं पादपैर्मधुगन्धिभिः । नानानिनादैरुद्यानं रम्यं मृगगणैर्द्विजैः ।।
अनेकगन्धप्रवहं पुण्यगन्धं मनोरमम् । शैलेन्द्रमिव गन्धाढ्यं द्वितीयं गन्धमादनम् ।।
अशोकवनिकायां तु तस्यां वानरपुंगवः । स ददर्शाविदूरस्थं चैत्यप्रासादमूर्जितम् ।।
मध्ये स्तम्भसहस्रेण स्थितं कैलासपाण्डुरम् । प्रवालकृतसोपानं तप्तकाञ्चनवेदिकम् ।।
मुष्णन्तमिव चक्षूंषि द्योतमानमिव श्रिया । विमलं प्रांशुभावत्वादुल्लिखन्तमिवाम्बरम् ।।
ततो मलिनसंवीतां राक्षसीभिः समावृताम् । उपवासकृशां दीनां निःश्वसान्तीं पुनः पुनः । ददर्श शुक्लपक्षादौ चन्द्ररेखामिवामलाम् ।।

data.es: Then he beheld a lady surrounded by female demons. Clad in soiled clothes she looked dejected, emaciated through fasting and was sighing repeatedly. She appeared thin and pale like the crescent Moon at the beginning of the bright fortnight.

data.v: मन्दप्रख्यायमानेन रूपेण रुचिरप्रभाम् । पिनद्धां धूमजालेन शिखामिव विभावसोः ।।

data.es: She was wearing an excellent single yellow cloth which was soiled. Unadorned, she looked like a muddy lotuspond bereft of lotuses.

data.v: व्रीडितां दुःखसंतप्तां परिम्लानां तपस्विनीम् । ग्रहेणाङ्गारकेणैव पीडितामिव रोहिणीम् ।।
data.es: She was bashful, tormented with agony, dejected with a withered look. She appeared like the star Rohini oppressed by planet Mars.

data.v: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां कृशामननशेन च । शोकध्यानपरां दीनां नित्यं दुःखपरायणाम् ।।
data.es: Her face was filled with tears. She looked dejected and emaciated due to fasting. Always plunged in grief, she looked like one meditating in tears.

data.v: प्रियं जनमपश्यन्तीं पश्यन्तीं राक्षसीगणम् । स्वगणेन मृगीं हीनां श्वगणाभिवृतामिव ।।
data.es: Unable to see her dear kith and kin, she sat guarded by ogresses. She appeared like a doe separated from the herd and encircled by a pack of hounds.

data.v: नीलनागाभया वेण्या जघनं गतयैकया । सुखार्हां दुःखसंतप्तां व्यसनानामकोदिवाम् ।।
data.es: She (from behind) appeared like the earth covered with a range of trees at the end of rainy season with her single long black braid touching her hips looking like a black serpent. She who deserved to be happy and had not experienced worries was burning in grief. (एकवेणी is a trait of a प्रोषितभर्तृका Sita who was forced to stay in Lanka was a प्रोषितभर्तृका नायिका.)

data.es: Just as the radiance of the full moon is cherished by all, this lady was liked by every one in this world. With her lovely figure she was seated on the ground like an austere ascetic.

They were blackened for long wear and Sita had marks of wearing them on her body.(Note: This is a pair ornaments shaped like dog's teeth. It is not known on which part of the body they were worn).

data.es: "This cloth worn long is crumpled. Even then it has retained its shine and looks fresh.

data.es: "This lady of golden complexion is Rama's beloved queen who does not disappear from his mind, although away.

data.v: इयं सा यत्कृते रामश्चतुर्भिः परितप्यते । कारुण्येनानृशंस्येन शोकेन मदनेन च ।।
data.es: "She is that same lady for whom Rama has been passing through compassion, benevolence, grief and passion. He is compassionate considering her a woman, kind and benevolent since she is his dependent, stricken with grief for losing a wife and passionate since she is his beloved.

data.es: "She is that same lady for whom Rama has been passing through compassion, benevolence, grief and passion. He is compassionate considering her a woman, kind and benevolent since she is his dependent, stricken with grief for losing a wife and passionate since she is his beloved.

data.v: अस्या देव्या यथा रूपमङ्गप्रत्यङ्गसौष्ठवम् । रामस्य च यथारूपं तस्येयमसितेक्षणा ।।
data.es: "This blackeyed Sita and her divine, charming body with perfect limbs are a match for Rama's figure.

data.v: अस्या देव्या मनस्तस्मिंस्तस्य चास्यां प्रतिष्ठितम् । तेनेयं स च धर्मात्मा मुहूर्तमपि जीवति ।।
data.es: "The divine queen's mind is firmly fixed on Rama and his mind, fixed on her. For this reason she and the righteous self (Rama) are able to survive till this moment.

data.v: दुष्करं कुरुते रामो य इमां मत्तकाशिनीम् । सीतां विना महाबाहुर्मुहूर्तमपि जीवति ।।
data.es: "Rama, the strongarmed hero has accomplished a difficult task by surviving even for a moment without this Sita who has intoxicating lustre".

data.v: एवं सीतां तदा दृष्ट्वा हृष्टः पवनसंभवः । जगाम मनसा रामं प्रशशंस च तं प्रभुम् ।।
प्रशस्य तु प्रशस्तव्यां सीतां तां हरिपुंगवः । गुणाभिरामं रामं च पुनश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, admired the laudable Sita and the virtuous Rama and once again began to lament.

data.es: Sagacious Hanuman, eyes dimmed with tears, thought for a short while on the plight of Sita and lamented

data.v: मान्या गुरुविनीतस्य लक्ष्मणस्य गुरुप्रिया । यदि सीतापि दुःखार्ता कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः ।।
data.es: "If Sita, who is worshipped by righteous Lakshmana and loved by Rama is tortured like this, it shows it is difficult to trangress the force of time.

data.v: रामस्य व्यवसायज्ञा लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः । नात्यर्थं क्षुभ्यते देवी गङ्गेव जलदागमे ।।
data.es: "Just as river Ganga is not agitated by the rainbearing clouds, this Sita is not perturbed as she is aware of the prowess of Rama and might of Lakshmana.

data.v: तुल्यशीलवयोवृत्तां तुल्याभिजनलक्षणाम् । राघवोऽर्हति वैदेहीं तं चेयमसितेक्षणा ।।
data.es: "Sri Rama matches Vaidehi perfectly in character, age, behaviour, birth and auspicious signs. She is aware that he is the right person for her. Rama deserves Vaidehi and this blackeyed lady deserves him."

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा नवहेमाभां लोककान्तामिव श्रियम् । जगाम मनसा रामं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On seeing her glowing like fresh gold resembling goddess Lakshmi who is dear to the entire world, and thinking of Rama, Hanuman said:

data.v: अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्या हतो वाली महाबलः । रावणप्रतिमो वीर्ये कबन्धश्च निपातितः ।।
data.es: "It was for the sake of this largeeyed Sita that the powerful Vali and the heroic Kabandha who was equal to Ravana in heroism were killed.

data.v: विराधश्च हतः संख्ये राक्षसो भीमविक्रमः । वने रामेण विक्रम्य महेन्द्रेणेव शम्बरः ।।
data.es: "Rama killed Viradha of fearsome valour in the forest like Sambara by Indra.

data.v: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् । निहतानि जनस्थाने शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः ।।
खरश्च निहतः संख्ये त्रिशिराश्च निपातितः । दूषणश्च महातेजा रामेण विदितात्मना ।।
data.es: "Ogres like Khara and Trisira and the powerful Dooshana were kileed in battle by Rama endowed with selfknowledge.

data.v: ऐश्वर्यं वानराणां च दुर्लभं वालिपालितम् । अस्या निमित्ते सुग्रीवः प्राप्तवाँल्लोकसत्कृतम् ।।
data.es: On her account Sugriva obtained the coveted kingdom ruled by Vali which was a difficult proposition, and retained supremacy in the world.

data.v: सागरश्च मया क्रान्तः श्रीमान्नदनदीपतिः । अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्याः पुरी चेयं निरीक्षिता ।।
data.es: "On account of the largeeyed Sita I ventured to cross the lord of rivers, the sea, and came to this city.

data.v: यदि रामः समुद्रान्तां मेदिनीं परिवर्तयेत् । अस्याः कृते जगच्चापि युक्तमित्येव मे मतिः ।।
data.es: "Even if Rama turns this land stretching to the ocean upside down or even the entire world on account of her, it is justifiable, according to me.

data.v: राज्यं वा त्रिषु लोकेषु सीता वा जनकात्मजा । त्रैलोक्यराज्यं सकलं सीताया नाप्नुयात्कलाम् ।।
data.es: "The sovereignty over the three worlds will weigh less than one sixteenth part of Janaka's daughter, Sita.

data.v: इयं सा धर्मशीलस्य मैथिलस्य महात्मनः । सुता जनकराजस्य सीता भर्तृदृढव्रता ।।
data.es: She had risen from the land when tilled by the plough and was covered with auspicious paddy dust resembling the pollen grains of lotuses, this daughter of Janaka, the great righteous ruler of Mithila, This lady with unswerving devotion to her husband.

data.v: उत्थिता मेदिनीं भित्त्वा क्षेत्रे हलमुखक्षते । पद्मरेणुनिभैः कीर्णा शुभैः केदारपांसुभिः ।।
data.es: She had risen from the land when tilled by the plough and was covered with auspicious paddy dust resembling the pollen grains of lotuses, this daughter of Janaka, the great righteous ruler of Mithila, This lady with unswerving devotion to her husband.

data.v: विक्रान्तस्यार्यशीलस्य संयुगेष्वनिवर्तिनः । स्नुषा दशरथस्यैषा ज्येष्ठा राज्ञो यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: "This celebrated lady is the eldest daughterinlaw of the noble, valiant king Dasaratha who never returned from the battleground without being victorious.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः । इयं सा दयिता भार्या राक्षसी वशमागता ।।
data.es: "She is the loving wife of the righteous, grateful, wise and selfrealised Rama. She has fallen into the hands of these shedemons.

data.v: सर्वान्भोगान्परित्यज्य भर्तृस्नेहबलात्कृता । अचिन्तयित्वा दुःखानि प्रविष्टा निर्जनं वनम् ।।
संतुष्टा फलमूलेन भर्तृशुश्रूषणे रता । या परां भजते प्रीतिं वनेऽपि भवने यथा ।।
सेयं कनकवर्णाङ्गी नित्यं सुस्मितभाषिणी । सहते यातनामेतामनर्थानामभागिनी ।।
इमां तु शीलसंपन्नां द्रष्टुमिच्छति राघवः । रावणेन प्रमथितां प्रपामिव पिपासितः ।।
data.es: "Rama deserves to see her.Just as a thirsty man longs for the source of water, Rama pines for this highly virtuous lady who is tormented by Ravana.

data.v: अस्या नूनं पुनर्लाभाद्राघवः प्रीतिमेष्यति । राजा राज्यपरिभ्रष्टः पुनः प्राप्येव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: "Just as a king who had lost his kingdom feels happy on regaining it, surely Raghava will feel exhilarated when he gets her back.

data.v: कामभोगैः परित्यक्ता हीना बन्धुजनेन च । धारयत्यात्मनो देहं तत्समागमकाङ्क्षिणी ।।
data.es: Deprived of all sensual pleasures, and separated from her relatives, she is surviving with the hope of meeting them.

data.v: नैषा पश्यति राक्षस्यो नेमान्पुष्पफलद्रुमान् । एकस्थहृदया नूनं राममेवानुपश्यति ।।
data.es: She is looking at neither the shedemons nor these trees full of flowers and fruits. She is surely thinking of Rama with a singleminded attention.

data.v: भर्ता नाम परं नार्या भूषणं भूषणादपि । एषा हि रहिता तेन शोभनार्हा न शोभते ।।
