data.es: Ascending a glittering chariot inlaid with pure gold Aksha, the courageous bull among giants looking splendid like the rising Sun, marched forth towards the great vanara.

data.v: ततस्तपःसंग्रहसंचयार्जितं; प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालशोभितम् । पताकिनं रत्नविभूषितध्वजं; मनोजवाष्टाश्ववरैः सुयोजितम् ।।
data.es: The chariot was (strong as it was) gained by his austerities of high order. It was overlaid with pure gold armour, fixed with flags, and staff, studded with precious gems, yoked to the best of eight horses and endowed with the speed of mind.

data.v: सुरासुराधृष्यमसंगचारिणं; रविप्रभं व्योमचरं समाहितम् । सतूणमष्टासिनिबद्धबन्धुरं; यथाक्रमावेशितशक्तितोमरम् ।।
data.es: (The chariot) was unassailable to suras or asuras.It moved without touching the ground, it could fly in air and had the splendour of the Sun. It was equipped readily with quivers, eight swords, javelins and clubs placed in right order.

data.v: विराजमानं प्रतिपूर्णवस्तुना; सहेमदाम्ना शशिसूर्यवर्वसा । दिवाकराभं रथमास्थितस्ततः; स निर्जगामामरतुल्यविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Prince Aksha, whose courage was equal to that of gods, shone like the Sun. He ascended the splendid chariot decked with golden garlands shining like Sun and Moon, equipped with all weapons, bows and shields etc, he went out.

data.v: स पूरयन्खं च महीं च साचलां; तुरंगमतङ्गमहारथस्वनैः । बलैः समेतैः स हि तोरणस्थितं; समर्थमासीनमुपागमत्कपिम् ।।
data.es: Seated on the chariot he (Aksha) sallied forth along with the army filling the entire earth and mountains with the sounds of horses, elephants and rumblings of big chariots and reached the portal where the great vanara stood.

data.v: स तं समासाद्य हरिं हरीक्षणो; युगान्तकालाग्निमिव प्रजाक्षये । अवस्थितं विस्मितजातसंभ्रमः; समैक्षताक्षो बहुमानचक्षुषा ।।
data.es: The lioneyed Aksha saw the vanara who appeared like the cosmic fire at the time of dissolution of the universe. The prince was astonished and struck with awe (at the majestic form of the Vanara) and looked at him with great respect.

data.v: स तस्य वेगं च कपेर्महात्मनः; पराक्रमं चारिषु पार्थिवात्मजः । विचारयन्खं च बलं महाबलो; हिमक्षये सूर्य इवाभिवर्धते ।।
data.es: Aksha, the mighty prince judging the speed and prowess of the monkey with his own in confronting enemies and the strength of the monkey, began to swell up in spirit like the glow of the Sun at the end of winter.

data.v: स जातमन्युः प्रसमीक्ष्य विक्रमं; स्थिरः स्थितः संयति दुर्निवारणम् । समाहितात्मा हनुमन्तमाहवे; प्रचोदयामास शरैस्त्रिभिः शितैः ।।
data.es: Knowing that it is difficult to win Hanuman who was steady and of irresistible valour Aksha was angry. Remaining steady, with full attention, he provoked the vanara to fight and released three sharp arrows.

data.v: ततः कपिं तं प्रसमीक्ष्य गर्वितं; जितश्रमं शत्रुपराजयोर्जितम् । अवैक्षताक्षः समुदीर्णमानसः; सबाणपाणिः प्रगृहीतकार्मुकः ।।
data.es: Then Aksha contempuously looked at Hanuman who had conquered his fatigue and was determined to defeat the enemy. Holding in his hands his bow and arrows proudly, he reflected.

data.v: स हेमनिष्काङ्गदचारुकुण्डलः; समाससादाशु पराक्रमः कपिम् । तयोर्बभूवाप्रतिमः समागमः; सुरासुराणामपि संभ्रमप्रदः ।।
data.es: Adorned with armlets studded with golden coins and lovely earrings Aksha advanced instantaneously to meet the monkey. Their matchless combat excuitement and enthusiasm even among gods and demons.

data.v: ररास भूमिर्न तताप भानुमा;न्ववौ न वायुः प्रचचाल चाचलः । कपेः कुमारस्य च वीक्ष्य संयुगं; ननाद च द्यौरुदधिश्च चुक्षुभे ।।
data.es: Witnessing the fight between Hanuman and Prince Aksha, even the earth shrieked in agony, the Sun became dim, the wind stopped blowing, mountains were shaken, the sky thundered and even the ocean was agitated.

data.v: ततः स वीरः सुमुखान्पतत्रिणः; सुवर्णपुङ्खान्सविषानिवोरगान् । समाधिसंयोगविमोक्षतत्त्ववि;च्छरानथ त्रीन्कपिमूर्ध्न्यपातयत् ।।
data.es: Heroic Aksha, who was good at targeting correctly, with due concentration struck the vanara on his head with three goldenshafted, winged arrows with feathers smeared with poison which resembled serpents.

data.v: स तैः शरैर्मूर्ध्नि समं निपातितैः; क्षरन्नसृग्दिग्धविवृत्तलोचनः । नवोदितादित्यनिभः शरांशुमा;न्व्यराजतादित्य इवांशुमालिकः ।।
data.es: With the three arrows shot on his forehead simultaneously his eyes were drenched with flowing blood and with arrows shining like rays he appeared like the rising Sun, garlanded by glowing rays.

data.v: ततः स पिङ्गाधिपमन्त्रिसत्तमः; समीक्ष्य तं राजवरात्मजं रणे । उदग्रचित्रायुधचित्रकार्मुकं; जहर्ष चापूर्यत चाहवोन्मुखः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the esteemed minister of the copperyeyed Sugriva observed the prince holding manifold splendid weapons. He rejoiced, grew in size ready to fight, making the necessary prepararions (taking the required position).

data.v: स मन्दराग्रस्थ इवांशुमाली; विवृद्धकोपो बलवीर्यसंयुतः । कुमारमक्षं सबलं सवाहनं; ददाह नेत्राग्निमरीचिभिस्तदा ।।
data.es: Huge Hanuman, endowed with strength and valour looked like the rising Sun on the peak of mount Mandara. He looked at prince Aksha and his army as well as his vehicles as though he was burning them with the rays emerging from his fiery eyes.

data.v: ततः स बाणासनशक्रकार्मुकः; शरप्रवर्षो युधि राक्षसाम्बुदः । शरान्मुमोचाशु हरीश्वराचले; बलाहको वृष्टिमिवाचलोत्तमे ।।
data.es: Aksha, with his wonderful quiver and bow, began to rain rapidly a shower of arrows in the battle, on the mountainlike monkeylord just as a cloud rains on a mountain.

data.v: ततः कपिस्तं रणचण्डविक्रमं; विवृद्धतेजोबलवीर्यसायकम् । कुमारमक्षं प्रसमीक्ष्य संयुगे; ननाद हर्षाद्घनतुल्यविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman saw prince Aksha, endowed with excessive splendour, power and energy advancing in a fierce manner like a cloud in the battle. Then Hanuman happy (to see the heroic prince) roared like a clap of thunder.

data.v: स बालभावाद्युधि वीर्यदर्पितः; प्रवृद्धमन्युः क्षतजोपमेक्षणः । समाससादाप्रतिमं रणे कपिं; गजो महाकूपमिवावृतं तृणैः ।।
data.es: Young Aksha, proud of his valour with eyes bloodshot in anger rushed towards the matchless Hanuman, just as an elephant would approach a huge pitfall covered with grass.

data.v: स तेन बाणैः प्रसभं निपातितै;श्चकार नादं घननादनिःस्वनः । समुत्पपाताशु नभः स मारुति;र्भुजोरुविक्षेपण घोरदर्शनः ।।
data.es: Struck by the arrows released by prince Aksha, Hanuman roared violently like a thundering cloud and leaped into the sky putting up a fierce appearance, stretching his arms and thighs.

data.v: समुत्पतन्तं समभिद्रवद्बली; स राक्षसानां प्रवरः प्रतापवान् । रथी रथश्रेष्ठतमः किरञ्शरैः; पयोधरः शैलमिवाश्मवृष्टिभिः ।।
स ताञ्शरांस्तस्य विमोक्षयन्कपि;श्चचार वीरः पथि वायुसेविते । शरान्तरे मारुतवद्विनिष्पत;न्मनोजवः संयति चण्डविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Dodging like the wind between the arrows and also escaping the arrows Hanuman, who was swift in movement like the mind, was seen exhibiting his terrific valour in the battle while he moved in the sky.

data.v: तमात्तबाणासनमाहवोन्मुखं; खमास्तृणन्तं विविधैः शरोत्तमैः । अवैक्षताक्षं बहुमानचक्षुषा; जगाम चिन्तां च स मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Admiring the young Aksha's appearance, his skill in holding the quiver and spreading the excellent arrows with missiles and facing the war, Hanuman became thoughtful (as to how to kill him).

data.v: ततः शरैर्भिन्नभुजान्तरः कपिः; कुमारवर्येण महात्मना नदन् । महाभुजः कर्मविशेषतत्त्ववि;द्विचिन्तयामास रणे पराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: The strongarmed Hanuman, who was aware of the propriety of actions, wounded in his arms by the warrior prince started roaring and thinking about the next strategy in the combat.

data.v: अबालवद्बालदिवाकरप्रभः; करोत्ययं कर्म महन्महाबलः । न चास्य सर्वाहवकर्मशोभिनः; प्रमापणे मे मतिरत्र जायते ।।
data.es: 'He (Aksha) is like the radiant, rising Sun with extraordinary might. He is accomplishing great deeds unlike young warriors of his age and is exhibiting a magnificent feat. He knows all means of fighting. I do not feel like cutting him to size. My mind does not allow me to kill this boy.

data.v: अयं महात्मा च महांश्च वीर्यतः; समाहितश्चातिसहश्च संयुगे । असंशयं कर्मगुणोदयादयं; सनागयक्षैर्मुनिभिश्च पूजितः ।।
data.es: 'He is a great self. His valour is also admirable. He is focused in battle and highly tolerant. There is no doubt that on account of his excellence even nagas, yakshas and sages offer salutations to him.

data.v: पराक्रमोत्साहविवृद्धमानसः; समीक्षते मां प्रमुखागतः स्थितः । पराक्रमो ह्यस्य मनांसि कम्पये;त्सुरासुराणामपि शीघ्रकारिणः ।।
data.es: 'His mental horizon is enhanced by his valour and power. He is standing before me and dares to look into my eyes. Surely his swift movement and valour will shake even the minds of suras and asuras.

data.v: न खल्वयं नाभिभवेदुपेक्षितः; पराक्रमो ह्यस्य रणे विवर्धते । प्रमापणं त्वेव ममास्य रोचते; न वर्धमानोऽग्निरुपेक्षितुं क्षमः ।।
data.es: If I ignore him now, he would get the better of me (I have to consider his challenge seriously). His valour in the battle is growing. It is proper to subdue him now. A spreading fire cannot be neglected.

data.v: इति प्रवेगं तु परस्य तर्कय;न्स्वकर्मयोगं च विधाय वीर्यवान् । चकार वेगं तु महाबलस्तदा; मतिं च चक्रेऽस्य वधे महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Reflecting on the power of the enemy, the mighty and valiant vanara thought of his own course of action. Hanuman made up his mind to kill the enemy and increased his speed.

data.v: स तस्य तानष्टहयान्महाजवा;न्समाहितान्भारसहान्विवर्तने । जघान वीरः पथि वायुसेविते; तलप्रहालैः पवनात्मजः कपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman the brave son of the Windgod hit with his palm and killed the eight horses (yoked to Aksha's chariot) which had great speed were stable and had the capacity to bear heavy loads while turning round in the sky. (The battle was fought in the air since Hanuman leaped into the air and the demon hero had to resist him there).

data.v: ततस्तलेनाभिहतो महारथः; स तस्य पिङ्गाधिपमन्त्रिनिर्जितः । स भग्ननीडः परिमुक्तकूबरः; पपात भूमौ हतवाजिरम्बरात् ।।
data.es: Then hit by Hanuman with his palm, the minister of the copperyeyed Sugriva, the huge chariot seat of Aksha was broken, the wooden frame of the yoke was disjointed, horses were slain and the great chariot fell down from the sky.

data.v: स तं परित्यज्य महारथो रथं; सकार्मुकः खड्गधरः खमुत्पतत् । तपोऽभियोगादृषिरुग्रवीर्यवा;न्विहाय देहं मरुतामिवालयम् ।।
ततः कपिस्तं विचरन्तमम्बरे; पतत्रिराजानिलसिद्धसेविते । समेत्य तं मारुतवेगविक्रमः; क्रमेण जग्राह च पादयोर्दृढम् ।।
data.es: Thereupon Hanuman with the prowess that was equal to wind, approaching the sky firmly caught hold of the legs of Aksha flying into the abode of Garuda, the Windgod and the Siddhas.

data.v: स तं समाविध्य सहस्रशः कपि;र्महोरगं गृह्य इवाण्डजेश्वरः । मुमोच वेगात्पितृतुल्यविक्रमो; महीतले संयति वानरोत्तमः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the foremost of the vanaras who was equal to his father in valour, seized him just as Garuda, the lord of birds, would seize a great serpent. And spinning him round speedily a thousand times and hitting him, dropped him on the earth.

data.v: स भग्नबाहूरुकटीशिरो धरः; क्षरन्नसृन्निर्मथितास्थिलोचनः । स भिन्नसंधिः प्रविकीर्णबन्धनो; हतः क्षितौ वायुसुतेन राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Hit by Hanuman, the ogre's arms, thighs, hips and neck broken, bones rendered to fragments, eyes protruded, joints disjointed, tendons strewn he was thrown down on the earth dripping blood.

data.v: महाकपिर्भूमितले निपीड्य तं; चकार रक्षोऽधिपतेर्महद्भयम् ।।
महर्षिभिश्चक्रचरैर्महाव्रतैः; समेत्य भूतैश्च सयक्षपन्नगैः । सुरैश्च सेन्द्रैर्भृशजातविस्मयै;र्हते कुमारे स कपिर्निरीक्षितः ।।
data.es: When the great vanara dashed Aksha down on to the earth, the king of demons was struck with terror. The great sages who go round the planets, great seers who were observants of vows, yakshas, panagas, suras including Indra all beings collected together and looked at the vanara with awe.

data.v: निहत्य तं वज्रसुतोपमप्रभं; कुमारमक्षं क्षतजोपमेक्षणम् । तदेव वीरोऽभिजगाम तोरणं; कृतक्षणः काल इव प्रजाक्षये ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the hero with bloodshot eyes having slain Aksha, shone resplendent like the son of Indra (Jayanta), and reached the portal, and waited looking like the god of death determined to destroy all beings. इत्यार्षे वाल्मीकीये श्रीमद्रामायणे आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततस्तु रक्षोऽधिपतिर्महात्मा; हनूमताक्षे निहते कुमारे । मनः समाधाय तदेन्द्रकल्पं; समादिदेशेन्द्रजितं स रोषात् ।।
data.es: Thereafter the great demon king, mighty angry at the death of Aksha in the hands of Hanuman, controlled his feeling and ordered Indrajit who was like a godhead.

data.v: त्वमस्त्रविच्छस्त्रभृतां वरिष्ठः; सुरासुराणामपि शोकदाता । सुरेषु सेन्द्रेषु च दृष्टकर्मा; पितामहाराधनसंचितास्त्रः ।।
data.es: "You are an expert in wielding astras (missiles) and foremost among the wielders of weapons. You are highly efficient. You have brought grief even to suras and asuras. You are a warrior of proven ability demonstrated in your war against the gods including Indra. By propitiating, (through penance), grandfather Brahma you have acquired many missiles.

data.v: तवास्त्रबलमासाद्य नासुरा न मरुद्गणाः । न कश्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु संयुगे न गतश्रमः ।।
data.es: "None could face you in war including Indra, Maruts and gods because of your skill and the power of your astras.

data.v: भुजवीर्याभिगुप्तश्च तपसा चाभिरक्षितः । देशकालविभागज्ञस्त्वमेव मतिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: "Excepting you there is none who has not experienced fatigue in war in the three worlds. You alone are intelligent in fighting. You are protected by the strength of your arms and power of austerity. You are aware of the proper place and time of action.

data.v: न तेऽस्त्यशक्यं समरेषु कर्मणा; न तेऽस्त्यकार्यं मतिपूर्वमन्त्रणे । न सोऽस्ति कश्चित्त्रिषु संग्रहेषु वै; न वेद यस्तेऽस्त्रबलं बलं च ते ।।
data.es: "Nothing is impossible for you in war. You do not consider with your wise judgment any action unfit for undertaking. There is none in all the three worlds who is unaware of the strength of your weapons and your power to recall through Mantra the weapon you have discharged.

data.v: ममानुरूपं तपसो बलं च ते; पराक्रमश्चास्त्रबलं च संयुगे । न त्वां समासाद्य रणावमर्दे; मनः श्रमं गच्छति निश्चितार्थम् ।।
data.es: "The power of your penance, your valour and your ability to discharge astras in war is equal only to mine. I am not bothered about the consequences of war you wage because your victory is certain.

data.v: निहता इंकराः सर्वे जम्बुमाली च राक्षसः । अमात्यपुत्रा वीराश्च पञ्च सेनाग्रयायिनः ।।
सहोदरस्ते दयितः कुमारोऽक्षश्च सूदितः । न तु तेष्वेव मे सारो यस्त्वय्यरिनिषूदन ।।
data.es: "Your dear young brother Aksha is killed. O scourage of enemies I do not have the faith in them as I have in you.

data.v: इदं हि दृष्ट्वा मतिमन्महद्बलं; कपेः प्रभावं च पराक्रमं च । त्वमात्मनश्चापि समीक्ष्य सारं; कुरुष्व वेगं स्वबलानुरूपम् ।।
data.es: "O intelligent warrior measure the strength, power and valour of the monkey and your own strength carefully. Exercise your own strength and speed accordingly.

data.v: बलावमर्दस्त्वयि संनिकृष्टे; यथा गते शाम्यति शान्तशत्रौ । तथा समीक्ष्यात्मबलं परं च; समारभस्वास्त्रविदां वरिष्ठ ।।
data.es: "O warrior of extraordinary merit among the wielders of astras asses your strength approach the enemy in a manner by which he is subdued without causing further destruction to our army. Carefully measure your own strength and your enemy's before you start fighting.

data.v: न खल्वियं मतिः श्रेष्ठा यत्त्वां संप्रेषयाम्यहम् । इयं च राजधर्माणां क्षत्रस्य च मतिर्मता ।।
data.es: "I am reluctant to send you to war in the circumstances. But you are the best choice for me. However, certainly this is the duty of a kshatriya who follows the science of polity. Hence I am sending you.

data.v: नानाशस्त्रैश्च संग्रामे वैशारद्यमरिंदम । अवश्यमेव बोद्धव्यं काम्यश्च विजयो रणे ।।
data.es: "O subduer of enemies you are capable of handling different kinds of weapons. Therefore, understand that I seek only your ultimate triumph in war.

data.v: ततः पितुस्तद्वचनं निशम्य; प्रदक्षिणं दक्षसुतप्रभावः । चकार भर्तारमदीनसत्त्वो; रणाय वीरः प्रतिपन्नबुद्धिः ।।
data.es: Hearing the father's words (of exhortation), he, who is never distressed at the prospect of war decided to seek the battle as he was powerful like the son of Daksha, and went round his father with respect.

data.v: ततस्तैः स्वगणैरिष्टैरिन्द्रजित्प्रतिपूजितः । युद्धोद्धतकृतोत्साहः संग्रामं प्रतिपद्यत ।।
data.es: Having been honoured by his own kith and kin who loved him, Indrajit rushed forth for war with martial vigour.

data.v: श्रीमान्पद्मपलाशाक्षो राक्षसाधिपतेः सुतः । निर्जगाम महातेजाः समुद्र इव पर्वसु ।।
data.es: When the illustrious son of Ravana, the highly Indrajit resplendent with eyes of lotus petals marched ahead he looked like the turbulent ocean on a fullmoon day.

data.v: स पक्षि राजोपमतुल्यवेगै;र्व्यालैश्चतुर्भिः सिततीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रैः । रथं समायुक्तमसंगवेगं; समारुरोहेन्द्रजिदिन्द्रकल्पः ।।
data.es: Like Indra, Indrajit ascended the chariot (which had the standard of Indra as it was seized from him as a token of his having conquered Indra) yoked to four sharptoothed tigers. It moved in swiftness vying with Garuda, the king of birds in speed.

data.v: स रथी धन्विनां श्रेष्ठः शस्त्रज्ञोऽस्त्रविदां वरः । रथेनाभिययौ क्षिप्रं हनूमान्यत्र सोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: Mounted on the chariot, Indrajit, the best in archery and an expert in weaponry went quickly to the place where that great Hanuman was stationed.

data.v: स तस्य रथनिर्घोषं ज्यास्वनं कार्मुकस्य च । निशम्य हरिवीरोऽसौ संप्रहृष्टतरोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: The leader of the monkey also became happier on hearing the rumbling (of the chariot) and the twang of Indrajit's bowstring.

data.v: सुमहच्चापमादाय शितशल्यांश्च सायकान् । हनूमन्तमभिप्रेत्य जगाम रणपण्डितः ।।
data.es: Indrajit who was an adept in warfare, picked his highly powerful bow and aimed his sharpedged arrow at Hanuman.

data.v: तस्मिंस्ततः संयति जातहर्षे; रणाय निर्गच्छति बाणपाणौ । दिशश्च सर्वाः कलुषा बभूवु;र्मृगाश्च रौद्रा बहुधा विनेदुः ।।
data.es: When he sallied forth happily holding a bow full of passion for war, darkness prevailed in all quarters and it became gloomy. Beasts began to howl in various frightful ways.

data.v: समागतास्तत्र तु नागयक्षा; महर्षयश्चक्रचराश्च सिद्धाः । नभः समावृत्य च पक्षिसंघा; विनेदुरुच्चैः परमप्रहृष्टाः ।।
data.es: (To see the combat) the Nagas, Yakshas, seers and Siddhas who move round the heavenly orbits assembled in the sky. The birds collected in flocks in the sky and screeched loudly and happily.

data.v: आयन्तं सरथं दृष्ट्वा तूर्णमिन्द्रजितं कपिः । विननाद महानादं व्यवर्धत च वेगवान् ।।
data.es: Hanuman of very high speed enlarged his body and roared, perceiving Indrajit's chariot coming swiftly.

data.v: इन्द्रजित्तु रथं दिव्यमास्थितश्चित्रकार्मुकः । धनुर्विस्फारयामास तडिदूर्जितनिःस्वनम् ।।
data.es: Indrajit on his part sat in his divine chariot holding a wonderful bow and in a lightning speed twanged it.

data.v: ततः समेतावतितीक्ष्णवेगौ; महाबलौ तौ रणनिर्विशङ्कौ । कपिश्च रक्षोऽधिपतेश्च पुत्रः; सुरासुरेन्द्राविव बद्धवैरौ ।।
data.es: Then the son of the demon king and Hanuman, both very fast in speed, mighty and powerful, fearless in war and like sura and asura closed in upon each other.

data.v: स तस्य वीरस्य महारथस्या; धनुष्मतः संयति संमतस्य । शरप्रवेगं व्यहनत्प्रवृद्ध;श्चचार मार्गे पितुरप्रमेयः ।।
data.es: Hanuman of immeasurable strength heaved himself to a huge proprtion and went moving on the path of his father (windgod) rendering useless the extraordinary speed of the arrows of Indrajit, who was great in chariot warfare, and an efficient archer.

data.v: ततः शरानायततीक्ष्णशल्या;न्सुपत्रिणः काञ्चनचित्रपुङ्खान् । मुमोच वीरः परवीरहन्ता; सुसंततान्वज्रनिपातवेगान् ।।
data.es: Then the heroic Indrajit, slayer of enemy warriors, discharged long arrows that were fixed with find feathers with sharppointed gold tips, bent a little at the tip touching the bow string, as swift as lightning.

data.v: स तस्य तत्स्यन्दननिःस्वनं च; मृदङ्गभेरीपटहस्वनं च । विकृष्यमाणस्य च कार्मुकस्य; निशम्य घोषं पुनरुत्पपात ।।
data.es: Thereupon, hearing the rumbling of the chariot, the sounds of mrudangas, bheris, and patahas drawing towards him, and percieving the loud twang of the bow (of Indrajit) Hanuman sprang up again.

data.v: शराणामन्तरेष्वाशु व्यवर्तत महाकपिः । हरिस्तस्याभिलक्षस्य मोक्षयँल्लक्ष्यसंग्रहम् ।।
data.es: The great tawny monkey moved quickly between spaces of arrows that were aimed at him rendering hosts of Indrajit's targets futile.

data.v: शराणामग्रतस्तस्य पुनः समभिवर्तत । प्रसार्य हस्तौ हनुमानुत्पपातानिलात्मजः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, son of the Windgod again stood facing the arrows directly stretching his hands and jumped (into the air).

data.v: तावुभौ वेगसंपन्नौ रणकर्मविशारदौ । सर्वभूतमनोग्राहि चक्रतुर्युद्धमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Both the warriors endowed with speed and skill in warfare carried on the fight which captivated the minds of all creatures.

data.v: हनूमतो वेद न राक्षसोऽन्तरं; न मारुतिस्तस्य महात्मनोऽन्तरम् । परस्परं निर्विषहौ बभूवतुः; समेत्य तौ देवसमानविक्रमौ ।।
data.es: The demon did not find a way to hit Hanuman. Maruti also found no opportunity to hit great Indrajit. Both of them being equal to gods in valour became too much to each other in war. (Both of them moved at meteoric speed making it difficult to aim at the enemy.)

data.v: ततस्तु लक्ष्ये स विहन्यमाने; शरेषु मोघेषु च संपतत्सु । जगाम चिन्तां महतीं महात्मा; समाधिसंयोगसमाहितात्मा ।।
data.es: Indrajit's infallible arrows missed Hanuman. Then the great warrior became perplexed and started thinking seriously within himself entering into a reflective mood.

data.v: ततो मतिं राक्षसराजसूनु;श्चकार तस्मिन्हरिवीरमुख्ये । अवध्यतां तस्य कपेः समीक्ष्य; कथं निगच्छेदिति निग्रहार्थम् ।।
data.es: Then Indrajit, son of the demon king, thinking that a vanara should not be killed started considering other means of catching hm.

data.v: ततः पैतामहां वीरः सोऽस्त्रमस्त्रविदां वरः । संदधे सुमहातेजास्तं हरिप्रवरं प्रति ।।
data.es: Then the heroic master of weapons, an excellent and glorious warrior directed the Brahmastram towards the foremost of monkeys.

data.v: अवध्योऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा तमस्त्रेणास्त्रतत्त्ववित् । निजग्राह महाबाहुर्मारुतात्मजमिन्द्रजित् ।।
data.es: Indrajit, the strongarmed hero, who knew the secrets of all missiles, realising that the son of the Windgod cannot be killed caught him by the divine weapon of Brahma (Brahmastram).

data.v: तेन बद्धस्ततोऽस्त्रेण राक्षसेन स वानरः । अभवन्निर्विचेष्टश्च पपात च महीतले ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman bound by the weapon of the demon was unable to move and fell on the ground.

data.v: ततोऽथ बुद्ध्वा स तदास्त्रबन्धं; प्रभोः प्रभावाद्विगताल्पवेगः । पितामहानुग्रहमात्मनश्च; विचिन्तयामास हरिप्रवीरः ।।
data.es: The monkey leader realised that his speed was arrested by the power of the lord Brahma, by the strength of the bond of Brahmastram. He then recalled lord Brahma's boon to him.

data.v: ततः स्वायम्भुवैर्मन्त्रैर्ब्रह्मास्त्रमभिमन्त्रितम् । हनूमांश्चिन्तयामास वरदानं पितामहात् ।।
data.es: Hanuman realised that it was by invoking creator Brahma and applying the mantra that he was caught by Brahmastram. On that occasion he started thinking of the boon given to him by Grandsire Brahma :

data.v: न मेऽस्त्रबन्धस्य च शक्तिरस्ति; विमोक्षणे लोकगुरोः प्रभावात् । इत्येवमेवंविहितोऽस्त्रबन्धो; मयात्मयोनेरनुवर्तितव्यः ।।
data.es: 'I deem it an effect of the power of Brahma. It is not possiblle for me to free myself due to the power of the great lord presiding over the universe through the astra. It should be obeyed'.

data.v: स वीर्यमस्त्रस्य कपिर्विचार्य; पितामहानुग्रहमात्मनश्च । विमोक्षशक्तिं परिचिन्तयित्वा; पितामहाज्ञामनुवर्तते स्म ।।
data.es: Reflecting within himself about the power of the astra, Hanuman recalled Braham's favour to him. He recalled his own power to liberate himself from the Brahmastra and resolved to abide by the order of Brahma.

data.v: अस्त्रेणापि हि बद्धस्य भयं मम न जायते । पितामहमहेन्द्राभ्यां रक्षितस्यानिलेन च ।।
data.es: 'Even though I am bound by the astra, I have the protection of both Brahma and Indra as well as the Windgod. Hence there is no cause for apprension.

data.v: ग्रहणे चापि रक्षोभिर्महन्मे गुणदर्शनम् । राक्षसेन्द्रेण संवादस्तस्माद्गृह्णन्तु मां परे ।।
data.es: 'If I am caught by the demon I will have the opportunity to see the demon lord. Therefore, let me be caught by my enemies'.

data.v: स निश्चितार्थः परवीरहन्ता; समीक्ष्य करी विनिवृत्तचेष्टः । परैः प्रसह्याभिगतैर्निगृह्य; ननाद तैस्तैः परिभर्त्स्यमानः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति त्रिष्टुभ्: उपेन्द्रवज्रा [११: जतजगग], अज्ञातम् [११: जजजगग]

data.es: Hanuman, a destroyer of enemies, who assesses before he acts, resolved (to submit to the ordinance of Brahma), to be silent (the power of his movement affected). When the enemy forces came to him slowly and slowly, siezed him forcibly and abused him, he roared.

data.v: ततस्तं राक्षसा दृष्ट्वा निर्विचेष्टमरिंदमम् । बबन्धुः शणवल्कैश्च द्रुमचीरैश्च संहतैः ।।
data.es: Then the ogres had Hanuman, the subduer of enemies, who made no effort to move, bound with hemp rope and bark robes.

data.v: स रोचयामास परैश्च बन्धनं; प्रसह्य वीरैरभिनिग्रहं च । कौतूहलान्मां यदि राक्षसेन्द्रो; द्रष्टुं व्यवस्येदिति निश्चितार्थः ।।
data.es: Bound by the enemy warriors, Hanuman, decided to bear all humiliations, thinking, 'May be the demon king might come to see me out of curiosity if he is so disposed'.

data.v: स बद्धस्तेन वल्केन विमुक्तोऽस्त्रेण वीर्यवान् । अस्त्रबन्धः स चान्यं हि न बन्धमनुवर्तते ।।
data.es: On being bound by bark ropes Hanuman was set free from the bond of Brahmastra, since the bondage of Brahmastra does not tolerate another ordinary bondage.

data.v: अथेन्द्रजित्तं द्रुमचीरबन्धं; विचार्य वीरः कपिसत्तमं तम् । विमुक्तमस्त्रेण जगाम चिन्ता;मन्येन बद्धो ह्यनुवर्ततेऽस्त्रम् ।।
data.es: Then the heroic Indrajit coming to know that the foremost of the monkeys bound by bark ropes was released from the bondage of Brahmastra, thought, 'indeed the divine weapon does not tolerate other bonds, so the vanara is released'.

data.v: अहो महत्कर्म कृतं निरर्थकं; न राक्षसैर्मन्त्रगतिर्विमृष्टा । पुनश्च नास्त्रे विहतेऽस्त्रमन्य;त्प्रवर्तते संशयिताः स्म सर्वे ।।
अस्त्रेण हनुमान्मुक्तो नात्मानमवबुध्यते । कृष्यमाणस्तु रक्षोभिस्तैश्च बन्धैर्निपीडितः ।।
data.es: Though binding and dragging by the ogres had hurt Hanuman, he on his part did not know that he had been released from Brahmastra.

data.v: हन्यमानस्ततः क्रूरै राक्षसैः काष्ठमुष्टिभिः । समीपं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य प्राकृष्यत स वानरः ।।
data.es: The cruel ogres hit Hanuman with sticks and fists and dragged him to the presence of the demon lord.

data.v: अथेन्द्रजित्तं प्रसमीक्ष्य मुक्त;मस्त्रेण बद्धं द्रुमचीरसूत्रैः । व्यदर्शयत्तत्र महाबलं तं; हरिप्रवीरं सगणाय राज्ञे ।।
data.es: Then Indarjit, seeing the powerful Hanuman, the foremost of monkeys who was released from the Brahmastra, still bound by bark ropes, presented him to the ogres and their master in the royal assembly.

data.v: तं मत्तमिव मातङ्गं बद्धं कपिवरोत्तमम् । राक्षसा राक्षसेन्द्राय रावणाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.es: The ogres presented the best of monkeys, Hanuman looking like an elephant in rut to Ravana, the demon king.

data.v: कोऽयं कस्य कुतो वापि किं कार्यं को व्यपाश्रयः । इति राक्षसवीराणां तत्र संजज्ञिरे कथाः ।।
data.es: "Who is he? Whose son is he? Why has he come here? Where has he come from? What business does he have here?" Thus the heroic demons talked among themselves.

data.v: हन्यतां दह्यतां वापि भक्ष्यतामिति चापरे । राक्षसास्तत्र संक्रुद्धाः परस्परमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Thereafter other ogres angrily said 'Let us kill him, burn him or otherwise devour him,' thus they spoke to one another.

data.v: अतीत्य मार्गं सहसा महात्मा; स तत्र रक्षोऽधिपपादमूले । ददर्श राज्ञः परिचारवृद्धा;न्गृहं महारत्नविभूषितं च ।।
data.es: The great Hanuman moving quickly and crossing the path came near the feet of the king. He saw the aged and experienced ministers of the king and the palace of the king adorned with precious gems.

data.v: स ददर्श महातेजा रावणः कपिसत्तमम् । रक्षोभिर्विकृताकारैः कृष्यमाणमितस्ततः ।।
data.es: Resplendent Ravana saw the ogres of ugly appearance dragging the foremost of the monkeys here and there.

data.v: राक्षसाधिपतिं चापि ददर्श कपिसत्तमः । तेजोबलसमायुक्तं तपन्तमिव भास्करम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman the best of monkeys also saw the demon king who had both splendour and strength, radiating brilliance like the Sun.

data.v: स रोषसंवर्तितताम्रदृष्टि;र्दशाननस्तं कपिमन्ववेक्ष्य । अथोपविष्टान्कुलशीलवृद्धा;न्समादिशत्तं प्रति मन्त्रमुख्यान् ।।
data.es: That tenheaded rakshasa king, rolling his red eyes rapidly in rage and observing the monkey unwinkingly ordered the noble and aged ministers of his clan to interrogate Hanuman.

data.v: यथाक्रमं तैः स कपिश्च पृष्टः; कार्यार्थमर्थस्य च मूलमादौ । निवेदयामास हरीश्वरस्य; दूतः सकाशादहमागतोऽस्मि ।।
data.es: At the very outset they questioned Hanuman manner in the usual about the place he came from and the purpose. Hanuman reported, 'I am Hanuman. I came as a messenger by the order of the king of monkeys'.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyeigth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततः स कर्मणा तस्य विस्मितो भीमविक्रमः । हनुमान्रोषताम्राक्षो रक्षोऽधिपमवैक्षत ।।
data.es: The highly courageous Hanuman, astonished at the action (of binding and dragging him to the court) by the demon king looked at him with eyes turned red in anger.

data.v: भाजमानं महार्हेण काञ्चनेन विराजता । मुक्ताजालावृतेनाथ मुकुटेन महाद्युतिम् ।।
data.es: (Hanuman looked at Ravana) of innate splendour, who shone with a glittering crown of gold glowing, encircled with strings of pearls.

data.v: वज्रसंयोगसंयुक्तैर्महार्हमणिविग्रहैः । हैमैराभरणैश्चित्रैर्मनसेव प्रकल्पितैः ।।
data.es: He was decked with wonderful golden ornaments studded with diamonds and had small motifs of precious gems fixed to them. They were as though designed by imagination. (An ornament made with the hand connot be so fine and delicate.)

data.v: महार्हक्षौमसंवीतं रक्तचन्दनरूषितम् । स्वनुलिप्तं विचित्राभिर्विविधभिश्च भक्तिभिः ।।
data.es: He was dressed in exquisite silk and smeared with red sandal paste and had many ornamental designs drawn on his body with fragrant unguents.

data.v: विपुलैर्दर्शनीयैश्च रक्षाक्षैर्भीमदर्शनैः । दीप्ततीक्ष्णमहादंष्ट्रैः प्रलम्बदशनच्छदैः ।।
data.es: He appeared terrible with bloodred eyes, shining sharp big teeth, drooping lips and ten heads, which looked like ten peaks of mountain Mandara inhabited by various beasts. He was heroic, powerful and splendid.

data.v: शिरोभिर्दशभिर्वीरं भ्राजमानं महौजसं । नानाव्यालसमाकीर्णैः शिखरैरिव मन्दरम् ।।
data.es: He appeared terrible with bloodred eyes, shining sharp big teeth, drooping lips and ten heads, which looked like ten peaks of mountain Mandara inhabited by various beasts. He was heroic, powerful and splendid.

data.v: नीलाञ्जनचय प्रख्यं हारेणोरसि राजता । पूर्णचन्द्राभवक्त्रेण सबलाकमिवाम्बुदम् ।।
data.es: He was like a black mountain of collyrium, and with a face like the fullmoon. With a pearl necklace illumining his chest he appeared like a cloud lit up by the fullmoon with white cranes flying across. (The white pearlnecklace moving on his chest appeared like a row of cranes flying through the black cloud.)

data.v: बाहुभिर्बद्धकेयूरैश्चन्दनोत्तमरूषितैः । भ्राजमानाङ्गदैः पीनैः पञ्चशीर्षैरिवोरगैः ।।
data.es: Adorned with armlets (keyura), smeared with choicest sandal paste, his shining, stout armlets appeared like many fivehooded serpents (fingers appearing like hoods).

data.v: महति स्फाटिके चित्रे रत्नसंयोगसंस्कृते । उत्तमास्तरणास्तीर्णे उपविष्टं वरासने ।।
data.es: (He was) seated on a huge magnificent throne of crystal encrusted with precious stones and overspread with a wonderful carpet.

data.v: अलंकृताभिरत्यर्थं प्रमदाभिः समन्ततः । वालव्यजनहस्ताभिरारात्समुपसेवितम् ।।
data.es: Young and beautiful girls decorated exceedingly well holding whisks all over the vicinity attended on him.

data.v: दुर्धरेण प्रहस्तेन महापार्श्वेन रक्षसा । मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रतत्त्वज्ञैर्निकुम्भेन च मन्त्रिणा ।।
data.es: He was attended by Durdhara, Prahasta, Mahaparsva and Nikumbha who were his learned ministers. Seated comfortably and attended by the four arrogant ministers, he was puffed with pride of their strength and appeared like the entire world surrounded by four oceans.

data.v: उपोपविष्टं रक्षोभिश्चतुर्भिर्बलदर्पितैः । कृत्स्नैः परिवृतं लोकं चतुर्भिरिव सागरैः ।।
data.es: He was attended by Durdhara, Prahasta, Mahaparsva and Nikumbha who were his learned ministers. Seated comfortably and attended by the four arrogant ministers, he was puffed with pride of their strength and appeared like the entire world surrounded by four oceans.

data.v: मन्त्रिभिर्मन्त्रतत्त्वज्ञैरन्यैश्च शुभबुद्धिभिः । अन्वास्यमानं सचिवैः सुरैरिव सुरेश्वरम् ।।
data.es: He was attended by ogres including ministers who were intellectuals and adept in counselling. He appeared like lord Indra attended by the gods.

data.v: अपश्यद्राक्षसपतिं हनूमानतितेजसं । विष्ठितं मेरुशिखरे सतोयमिव तोयदम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw the highly resplendent giant king (seated on the throne) who appeared like a cloud laden with water appearing on the peak of mount Meru.

data.v: स तैः संपीड्यमानोऽपि रक्षोभिर्भीमविक्रमैः । विस्मयं परमं गत्वा रक्षोऽधिपमवैक्षत ।।
data.es: Hanuman looked at the demon king with great amazement even while he was dealt harshly by the demons of fierce valour.

data.v: भ्राजमानं ततो दृष्ट्वा हनुमान्राक्षसेश्वरम् । मनसा चिन्तयामास तेजसा तस्य मोहितः ।।
data.es: Seeing Hanuman speeding in the sky a demoness called Simhika who can assume any form at her will had grown out of proportion and thought on her part:

data.v: अहो रूपमहो धैर्यमहो सत्त्वमहो द्युतिः । अहो राक्षसराजस्य सर्वलक्षणयुक्तता ।।
data.es: 'Oh what charm what courage what strength what splendour How great is this demonking, an endowment of all merits.

data.v: यद्यधर्मो न बलवान्स्यादयं राक्षसेश्वरः । स्यादयं सुरलोकस्य सशक्रस्यापि रक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'If only this lord of demons was not unrighteous, he could have become even the lord (protector) of gods including Indra.

data.v: तेन बिभ्यति खल्वस्माल्लोकाः सामरदानवाः । अयं ह्युत्सहते क्रुद्धः कर्तुमेकार्णवं जगत् ।।
data.es: 'This Ravana has done many cruel, fierce and contemptible deeds. That is why even the demons, gods and all the people of this world get scared of him. He will render the entire world into a single ocean when he turns angry'.

data.v: इति चिन्तां बहुविधामकरोन्मतिमान्कपिः । दृष्ट्वा राक्षसराजस्य प्रभावममितौजसः ।।
data.es: Many such thoughts crossed Hanuman's intelligent mind on seeing Ravana's brilliance and power.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तमुद्वीक्ष्य महाबाहुः पिङ्गाक्षं पुरतः स्थितम् । रोषेण महताविष्टो रावणो लोकरावणः ।।
data.es: The mighty armed Ravana, a tormentor of all worlds, overcome with anger beheld the tawnyeyed brilliant lord of monkeys who stood before him and started thinking in his mind full of apprehensions.

data.v: स राजा रोषताम्राक्षः प्रहस्तं मन्त्रिसत्तमम् । कालयुक्तमुवाचेदं वचो विपुलमर्थवत् ।।
data.es: The infuriated demon king told the great minister Prahasta, these profound words in a brief manner appropriate to the hour.

data.v: दुरात्मा पृच्छ्यतामेष कुतः किं वास्य कारणम् । वनभङ्गे च कोऽस्यार्थो राक्षसीनां च तर्जने ।।
data.es: "Enquire from this wicked one, why he has come and from where, Why he destroyed the garden and for what purpose he threatened the demonesses?

data.v: रावणस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रहस्तो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते न भीः कार्या त्वया कपे ।।
data.es: On hearing Ravana, Prahasta spoke these words boosting the monkey's morale 'O monkey Be relaxed. Feel safe. You need not entertain any fear.

data.v: यदि तावत्त्वमिन्द्रेण प्रेषितो रावणालयम् । तत्त्वमाख्याहि मा ते भूद्भयं वानर मोक्ष्यसे ।।
data.es: "Have you came to the abode of Ravana sent by Indra? Speak the truth. Be not afraid.You will be released".

data.v: यदि वैश्रवणस्य त्वं यमस्य वरुणस्य च । चारुरूपमिदं कृत्वा यमस्य वरुणस्य च ।।
विष्णुना प्रेषितो वापि दूतो विजयकाङ्क्षिणा । न हि ते वानरं तेजो रूपमात्रं तु वानरम् ।।
तत्त्वतः कथयस्वाद्य ततो वानर मोक्ष्यसे । अनृतं वदतश्चापि दुर्लभं तव जीवितम् ।।
अथ वा यन्निमित्तस्ते प्रवेशो रावणालये ।।
data.es: "If you tell a lie, it will be difficult for you to live. Or else, tell me for what reason have you entered the abode of Ravana.'

data.v: एवमुक्तो हरिवरस्तदा रक्षोगणेश्वरम् । अब्रवीन्नास्मि शक्रस्य यमस्य वरुणस्य वा ।।
data.es: The foremost of the vanaras spoke to the lord of ogres in response to the equiries made to him: "I have not come from Indra or Yama or Varuna. I have no friendship with Kubera. I have not been sent by Visnu. By birth I am vanara and I have come here.'

data.v: धनदेन न मे सख्यं विष्णुना नास्मि चोदितः । जातिरेव मम त्वेषा वानरोऽहमिहागतः ।।
data.es: The foremost of the vanaras spoke to the lord of ogres in response to the equiries made to him: "I have not come from Indra or Yama or Varuna. I have no friendship with Kubera. I have not been sent by Visnu. By birth I am vanara and I have come here.'

data.v: दर्शने राक्षसेन्द्रस्य दुर्लभे तदिदं मया । वनं राक्षसराजस्य दर्शनार्थे विनाशितम् ।।
ततस्ते राक्षसाः प्राप्ता बलिनो युद्धकाङ्क्षिणः । रक्षणार्थं च देहस्य प्रतियुद्धा मया रणे ।।
data.es: "Desiring to fight with me the powerful ogres came. Then I fought in self defence.

data.v: अस्त्रपाशैर्न शक्योऽहं बद्धुं देवासुरैरपि । पितामहादेव वरो ममाप्येषोऽभ्युपागतः ।।
data.es: "It is not possible to bind me with any bondage of astras even by devas or danavas. Such a boon has been granted to me by Grandfather Brahma.

data.v: राजानं द्रष्टुकामेन मयास्त्रमनुवर्तितम् । विमुक्तो अहमस्त्रेण राक्षसैस्त्वतिपीडितः ।।
data.es: "Wishing to see the king I honoured this astra and not otherwise. Even though I was tormented by the ogres and released by the astra I submitted to you as I have a small work assigned by the king.

data.v: दूतोऽहमिति विज्ञेयो राघवस्यामितौजसः । श्रूयतां चापि वचनं मम पथ्यमिदं प्रभो ।।
data.es: Know that I am a messenger of the highly powerful Rama. O lord please listen to these beneficial words of mine meant for your welfare.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तं समीक्ष्य महासत्त्वं सत्त्ववान्हरिसत्तमः । वाक्यमर्थवदव्यग्रस्तमुवाच दशाननम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the best of monkeys, looking at the very powerful Ravana spoke slowly these highly meaningful words.

data.v: अहं सुग्रीवसंदेशादिह प्राप्तस्तवालयम् । राक्षसेन्द्र हरीशस्त्वां भ्राता कुशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "By the command of Rama I am here as a messenger. He is keeping well. He is well and wishes you well.

data.v: भ्रातुः शृणु समादेशं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । धर्मार्थोपहितं वाक्यमिह चामुत्र च क्षमम् ।।
data.es: "The great Sugriva who is like your brother sends you a message pertinent to this world and the other world, that which is beneficial and consistent with righteousness and propriety (धर्म and अर्थ). Listen:

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान् । पितेव बन्धुर्लोकस्य सुरेश्वरसमद्युतिः ।।
data.es: "There was an illustrious king called Dasaratha in Ikshvaku race, a master of chariots, elephants and horses. He was highly meritorious and renowned.

data.v: ज्येष्ठस्तस्य महाबाहुः पुत्रः प्रियकरः प्रभुः । पितुर्निदेशान्निष्क्रान्तः प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् ।।
data.es: "His eldest son, a highly effulgent one, named Rama who was dear to the king, accepting his father's orders went into exile with brother Lakshmana and wife Sita also accepting a righteous path and entered Dandaka forest.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया चापि भार्यया । रामो नाम महातेजा धर्म्यं पन्थानमाश्रितः ।।
data.es: "His eldest son, a highly effulgent one, named Rama who was dear to the king, accepting his father's orders went into exile with brother Lakshmana and wife Sita also accepting a righteous path and entered Dandaka forest.

data.v: तस्य भार्या वने नष्टा सीता पतिमनुव्रता । वैदेहस्य सुता राज्ञो जनकस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Sita, daughter of king Janaka of Videha kingdom, loyally followed her husband, Rama. She was lost in the forest.

data.v: स मार्गमाणस्तां देवीं राजपुत्रः सहानुजः । ऋश्यमूकमनुप्राप्तः सुग्रीवेण च संगतः ।।
data.es: "Searching for the divine lady the prince reached mount Rshyamuka along with his brother and there he met Sugriva.

data.v: तस्य तेन प्रतिज्ञातं सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् । सुग्रीवस्यापि रामेण हरिराज्यं निवेदितम् ।।
data.es: "Sugriva promised Rama to undertake search for Sita and Rama assured Sugriva of securing him the kingdom of the monkeys.

data.v: ततस्तेन मृधे हत्वा राजपुत्रेण वालिनम् । सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये हर्यृक्षाणां गणेश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Then prince Rama killed Vali in battle and made Sugriva, king of the vanaras and bears and restored the kingship of Sugriva.

data.v: स सीतामार्गणे व्यग्रः सुग्रीवः सत्यसंगरः । हरीन्संप्रेषयामास दिशः सर्वा हरीश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Sugriva, who is true to his word and a faithful warrior, king of monkeys anxiously sent vanaras in all directions for searching Sita.

data.v: तां हरीणां सहस्राणि शतानि नियुतानि च । दिक्षु सर्वासु मार्गन्ते अधश्चोपरि चाम्बरे ।।
data.es: "This is Sita whom thousands of vanaras are searching in all directions.

data.v: वैनतेय समाः केचित्केचित्तत्रानिलोपमाः । असंगगतयः शीघ्रा हरिवीरा महाबलाः ।।
data.es: "Some of the very powerful heroes equal to Garuda, equal to the Windgod (in swiftness) have gone (in quest of Sita) without touching the earth.

data.v: अहं तु हनुमान्नाम मारुतस्यौरसः सुतः । सीतायास्तु कृते तूर्णं शतयोजनमायतम् । समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वैव तां दिदृक्षुरिहागतः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससजत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जसरय]

data.es: "I, Maruta's son, Hanuman by name too came swiftly leaping across a hundred yojanas across the ocean searching for Sita.

data.v: तद्भवान्दृष्टधर्मार्थस्तपः कृतपरिग्रहः । परदारान्महाप्राज्ञ नोपरोद्धुं त्वमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "While I was roaming I saw Janaka's daughter Sita at your house.You are a knower of the truth of righteousness. You are very wise and carrried out great austerities. It does not behove you to abduct another man's wife.

data.v: न हि धर्मविरुद्धेषु बह्वपायेषु कर्मसु । मूलघातिषु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.es: "Indeed, respectable people and wise men like you should not indulge in actions opposed to righteousness as it will strike at the very root of your existence.

data.v: कश्च लक्ष्मणमुक्तानां रामकोपानुवर्तिनाम् । शराणामग्रतः स्थातुं शक्तो देवासुरेष्वपि ।।
data.es: "Who, even among gods and asuras can withstand the arrows released by Lakshmana in obedience to the infuriated Rama's orders?

data.v: न चापि त्रिषु लोकेषु राजन्विद्येत कश्चन । राघवस्य व्यलीकं यः कृत्वा सुखमवाप्नुयात् ।।
data.es: "O king there is none in these three worlds who can enjoy happiness by displeasing Rama.

data.v: तत्त्रिकालहितं वाक्यं धर्म्यमर्थानुबन्धि च । मन्यस्व नरदेवाय जानकी प्रतिदीयताम् ।।
data.es: "Think that my advice is beneficial to you for you present, past and future. It is righteous. It will provide you material wealth too. Hence return Sita to the lord of the people.

data.v: दृष्टा हीयं मया देवी लब्धं यदिह दुर्लभम् । उत्तरं कर्म यच्छेषं निमित्तं तत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: "I have actually spotted the divine lady here which was most difficult. Rama will plan the remaining course of action.

data.v: लक्षितेयं मया सीता तथा शोकपरायणा । गृह्य यां नाभिजानासि पञ्चास्यामिव पन्नगीम् ।।
data.es: "I have seen Sita immersed in deep sorrow. You do not realise that by abducting her you are keeping a fivehooded female serpent in your house.

data.v: नेयं जरयितुं शक्या सासुरैरमरैरपि । विषसंसृष्टमत्यर्थं भुक्तमन्नमिवौजसा ।।
data.es: "Just as food mixed with venom cannot be digested by the great fire (fire of hunger), it is not possible to keep Sita even by gods and demons. (Sita is like food mixed with poison. Ravana cannot digest her with all his power.)

data.v: तपःसंतापलब्धस्ते योऽयं धर्मपरिग्रहः । न स नाशयितुं न्याय्य आत्मप्राणपरिग्रहः ।।
data.es: "You have acquired the merit of righteousness by prolonged hardships experienced during your penance. It is not proper to forfeit your own life in this way.

data.v: अवध्यतां तपोभिर्यां भवान्समनुपश्यति । आत्मनः सासुरैर्देवैर्हेतुस्तत्राप्ययं महान् ।।
data.es: "You know you will not be killed by asuras or gods. In that case also this (keeping Sita with you) may be the prime cause of your death.

data.v: सुग्रीवो न हि देवोऽयं नासुरो न च मानुषः । न राक्षसो न गन्धर्वो न यक्षो न च पन्नगः ।।
data.es: "Sugriva is not an demon, nor a danava nor gandharva, nor a yaksha nor even a pannaga. Therefore how can you save your life from Sugriva?

data.v: मानुषो राघवो राजन्सुग्रीवश्च हरीश्वरः । तस्मात्प्राणपरित्राणं कथं राजन्करिष्यसि ।।
न तु धर्मोपसंहारमधर्मफलसंहितम् । तदेव फलमन्वेति धर्मश्चाधर्मनाशनः ।।
data.es: "The fruit of dharma does not accrue to one who has reached the culmination of adharma. Unrighteousness will destroy the fruits of righteousness.

data.v: प्राप्तं धर्मफलं तावद्भवता नात्र संशयः । फलमस्याप्यधर्मस्य क्षिप्रमेव प्रपत्स्यसे ।।
data.es: "There is no doubt you have earned merit through righteousness (dharma destroys adharma and yields sweet fruit ultimately). But now you will quickly reap the result of your unrighteousness also.

data.v: जनस्थानवधं बुद्ध्वा बुद्ध्वा वालिवधं तथा । रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च बुध्यस्व हितमात्मनः ।।
data.es: "You know about the killing of all ogres at Janasthana and of Vali also. You know about the alliance of Rama and Sugriva. You may decide on a proper course of action for the sake of your own welfare.

data.v: कामं खल्वहमप्येकः सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम् । लङ्कां नाशयितुं शक्तस्तस्यैष तु विनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: " Alone, I can destroy this entire Lanka teeming with horses, chariots and elephants. Indeed I have the energy but not the mandate of Sri Rama.

data.v: रामेण हि प्रतिज्ञातं हर्यृक्षगणसंनिधौ । उत्सादनममित्राणां सीता यैस्तु प्रधर्षिता ।।
data.es: "Rama made a vow in the presence of bears and vanaras that he would exterminate the arrogant enemy troops by whom Sita is abducted and assaulted.

data.v: अपकुर्वन्हि रामस्य साक्षादपि पुरंदरः । न सुखं प्राप्नुयादन्यः किं पुनस्त्वद्विधो जनः ।।
data.es: "Indra, the destroyer of enemy citadels cannot live happily if he offends Rama. What to speak of persons like you?

data.v: यां सीतेत्यभिजानासि येयं तिष्ठति ते वशे । कालरात्रीति तां विद्धि सर्वलङ्काविनाशिनीम् ।।
data.es: "Sita who is under your custody is no ordinary lady. She is indeed the dark night of dissolution, destroyer of entire Lanka. Know this.

data.v: तदलं कालपाशेन सीता विग्रहरूपिणा । स्वयं स्कन्धावसक्तेन क्षममात्मनि चिन्त्यताम् ।।
data.es: "Stop holding the noose of death in Sita's form whom you yourself have placed on your shoulders. Think of your own welfare.

data.v: सीतायास्तेजसा दग्धां रामकोपप्रपीडिताम् । दह्यमनामिमां पश्य पुरीं साट्टप्रतोलिकाम् ।।
data.es: "Visualize this city of Lanka including its marketplaces and main streets as burnt by Sita's power of chastity and Rama's anger.

data.v: स सौष्ठवोपेतमदीनवादिनः; कपेर्निशम्याप्रतिमोऽप्रियं वचः । दशाननः कोपविवृत्तलोचनः; समादिशत्तस्य वधं महाकपेः ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana who was of matchless strength, hearing the unpleasant words of advice and warning expressed skilfully with dignity by the great Hanuman, enraged Ravana, his eyes rolling in anger ordered the execution of Hanuman.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वानरस्य महात्मनः । आज्ञापयद्वधं तस्य रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः ।।
data.es: On hearing the demon's haughty words, oppressed, pitiable Sita replied slowly in a sorrowful tone.

data.v: वधे तस्य समाज्ञप्ते रावणेन दुरात्मना । निवेदितवतो दौत्यं नानुमेने विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Vibhishana did not approve of the killing of Hanuman, who had declared that he was an envoy (of Sri Rama) when the wicked Ravana ordered his murder.

data.v: तं रक्षोऽधिपतिं क्रुद्धं तच्च कार्यमुपस्थितम् । विदित्वा चिन्तयामास कार्यं कार्यविधौ स्थितः ।।
data.es: Vibhishana who stood by the right course of action, having realised that the lord of demons was angry pondered over his duty.

data.v: निश्चितार्थस्ततः साम्नापूज्य शत्रुजिदग्रजम् । उवाच हितमत्यर्थं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: Then Vibhishana, who was skilled in speech having decided about his duty addressed his reverential elder brother, a conqueror of enemies in soothing, words in a meaningful, wholesome manner.

data.v: राजन्धर्मविरुद्धं च लोकवृत्तेश्च गर्हितम् । तव चासदृशं वीर कपेरस्य प्रमापणम् ।।
data.es: "Mighty king killing this Hanuman is contrary to righteousness of kings. This is deplorable diplomacy and also unbecoming of you.

data.v: असंशयं शत्रुरयं प्रवृद्धः; कृतं ह्यनेनाप्रियमप्रमेयम् । न दूतवध्यां प्रवदन्ति सन्तो; दूतस्य दृष्टा बहवो हि दण्डाः ।।
data.es: This enemy has done a lot of harm, no doubt. Indeed he has done terrible and unpleasant deeds. (Yet) the wise have recommended many alternate punishments, while prohibiting their killing.

data.v: वैरूप्यामङ्गेषु कशाभिघातो; मौण्ड्यं तथा लक्ष्मणसंनिपातः । एतान्हि दूते प्रवदन्ति दण्डा;न्वधस्तु दूतस्य न नः श्रुतोऽपि ।।

ch.n: उपजाति त्रिष्टुभ्: उपेन्द्रवज्रा [११: जतजगग], अज्ञातम् [११: मतजगग], इन्द्रवज्रा [११: ततजगग]

data.es: "Mutilation of limbs, flogging, shaving of the head, and deforming limbs etc. these punishments have been prescribed for an emissary. Never has killing of an emissary been heard.

data.v: कथं च धर्मार्थविनीतबुद्धिः; परावरप्रत्ययनिश्चितार्थः । भवद्विधः कोपवशे हि तिष्ठे;त्कोपं नियच्छन्ति हि सत्त्ववन्तः ।।
data.es: "You are wellversed in dharma and artha. Learned men first decide what is right or wrong (before imposing punishment). How are you swayed by unjust anger? Indeed courageous persons (like you) should control anger.

data.v: न धर्मवादे न च लोकवृत्ते; न शास्त्रबुद्धिग्रहणेषु वापि । विद्येत कश्चित्तव वीरतुल्य;स्त्वं ह्युत्तमः सर्वसुरासुराणाम् ।।
data.es: "Heroic Ravana there is hardly any one who is equal to you in the knowledge of dharma, in the practice of worldly affairs and in grasping subtle truths of sastras. Indeed you are supreme among suras and asuras.

data.v: न चाप्यस्य कपेर्घाते कंचित्पश्याम्यहं गुणम् । तेष्वयं पात्यतां दण्डो यैरयं प्रेषितः कपिः ।।
data.es: "I do not see any use in killing this monkey. Pronounce punishment on those who have sent this vanara.

data.v: साधुर्वा यदि वासाधुर्परैरेष समर्पितः । ब्रुवन्परार्थं परवान्न दूतो वधमर्हति ।।
data.es: "Whether he is soft or harsh, he has been sent by others. He is speaking on other's behalf and is dependent on them. An emissary does not deserve to be killed.

data.v: अपि चास्मिन्हते राजन्नान्यं पश्यामि खेचरम् । इह यः पुनरागच्छेत्परं पारं महोदधिः ।।
data.es: "O king If he is killed, I do not see any one who can cross this great ocean and come by air to reach this place.

data.v: तस्मान्नास्य वधे यत्नः कार्यः परपुरंजय । भवान्सेन्द्रेषु देवेषु यत्नमास्थातुमर्हति ।।
data.es: "You who can conquer citadels of enemies should not direct your efforts to kill an envoy.You are fit to make efforts against enemies like gods including Indra.

data.v: अस्मिन्विनष्टे न हि दूतमन्यं; पश्यामि यस्तौ नरराजपुत्रौ । युद्धाय युद्धप्रियदुर्विनीता;वुद्योजयेद्दीर्घपथावरुद्धौ ।।
data.es: "O lover of war if Hanuman is slain I do not see any one who can incite those two illmannered sons of the king who are prevented from reaching this faroff land.

data.v: पराक्रमोत्साहमनस्विनां च; सुरासुराणामपि दुर्जयेन । त्वया मनोनन्दन नैरृतानां; युद्धायतिर्नाशयितुं न युक्ता ।।
data.es: "O delighter of demons even the gods and demons who are endowed with valour and energy cannot win you. You are invincible. It is not proper for you to lose chances of a good war.

data.v: हिताश्च शूराश्च समाहिताश्च; कुलेषु जाताश्च महागुणेषु । मनस्विनः शस्त्रभृतां वरिष्ठाः; कोट्यग्रशस्ते सुभृताश्च योधाः ।।
data.es: "You have with you wellwishers, courageous ones, who have good qualities born in a good race, who are noble, sensible people, wielders of weapons and wellpaid warriors in crores.

data.v: तदेकदेशेन बलस्य ताव;त्केचित्तवादेशकृतोऽपयान्तु । तौ राजपुत्रौ विनिगृह्य मूढौ; परेषु ते भावयितुं प्रभावम् ।।
data.es: By your order let some strong soldiers from one contingency go and capture the two sons of the king, to exhibit your power over the enemy.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवो महाबलः । देशकालहितं वाक्यं भ्रातुरुत्तममब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana heard his brother, the greatsoul Vibhishana's timely advice which was in keeping with the laws of the land and replied.

data.v: सम्यगुक्तं हि भवता दूतवध्या विगर्हिता । अवश्यं तु वधादन्यः क्रियतामस्य निग्रहः ।।
data.es: "Indeed, you have spoken very well.Killing of emissary is censured (in sastras). Surely we will impose suitable punishment other than killing.

data.v: कपीनां किल लाङ्गूलमिष्टं भवति भूषणम् । तदस्य दीप्यतां शीघ्रं तेन दग्धेन गच्छतु ।।
data.es: "The tail is dear to the monkeys and it is an ornament for them. Set fire to it at once and let him go with his burning tail.

data.v: ततः पश्यन्त्विमं दीनमङ्गवैरूप्यकर्शितम् । समित्रा ज्ञातयः सर्वे बान्धवाः ससुहृज्जनाः ।।
data.es: "Then all his friends, relatives and his kinsmen will see his disfigured and handicapped form. The demon king having ordered thus, the monkey was taken by the ogres round the junctions of the roads all over the city with his tail on fire.

data.v: आज्ञापयद्राक्षसेन्द्रः पुरं सर्वं सचत्वरम् । लाङ्गूलेन प्रदीप्तेन रक्षोभिः परिणीयताम् ।।
data.es: "Then all his friends, relatives and his kinsmen will see his disfigured and handicapped form. The demon king having ordered thus, the monkey was taken by the ogres round the junctions of the roads all over the city with his tail on fire.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसाः कोपकर्कशाः । वेष्टन्ते तस्य लाङ्गूलं जीर्णैः कार्पासिकैः पटैः ।।
data.es: "Obeying the orders of the king, the brutally angry demons wrapped his tail with tatters of cotton.

data.v: संवेष्ट्यमाने लाङ्गूले व्यवर्धत महाकपिः । शुष्कमिन्धनमासाद्य वनेष्विव हुताशनः ।।
data.es: While the tail was being swathed, the great vanara grew in size like wild fire fed with dry firewood.

data.v: तैलेन परिषिच्याथ तेऽग्निं तत्रावपातयन् ।।
लाङ्गूलेन प्रदीप्तेन राक्षसांस्तानपातयत् । रोषामर्षपरीतात्मा बालसूर्यसमाननः ।।
data.es: The demons soaked the tail and set fire to it. His face burning in anger shone like the rising Sun and his mind seized with indignation, he struck them with the burning tail.

data.v: स भूयः संगतैः क्रूरै राकसैर्हरिसत्तमः । निबद्धः कृतवान्वीरस्तत्कालसदृशीं मतिम् ।।
data.es: When the cruel demons collected together and bound him once again the heroic Hanuman thought what was appropriate to the moment.

data.v: कामं खलु न मे शक्ता निबधस्यापि राक्षसाः । छित्त्वा पाशान्समुत्पत्य हन्यामहमिमान्पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Even though these ogres are not capable, they have bound me. Indeed I will leap (into the air) once again and sever my bonds and kill them.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव पर्याप्तो राक्षसानामहं युधि । किं तु रामस्य प्रीत्यर्थं विषहिष्येऽहमीदृशम् ।।
data.es: 'I am strong enough to destroy all the demons in a battle. I am enduring this humiliation in order to make Rama happy. In this way I will get a chance to see Lanka once again.

data.v: लङ्का चरयितव्या मे पुनरेव भवेदिति । रात्रौ न हि सुदृष्टा मे दुर्गकर्मविधानतः । अवश्यमेव द्रष्टव्या मया लङ्का निशाक्षये ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: तसतज], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जयनम], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसजर]

data.es: 'Indeed I saw Lanka at night for which I could not acquire proper knowledge about the fortification of the city. Surely it should be seen by me now after the night has passed.

data.v: कामं बन्धैश्च मे भूयः पुच्छस्योद्दीपनेन च । पीडां कुर्वन्तु रक्षांसि न मेऽस्ति मनसः श्रमः ।।
data.es: 'Let the demons torture me freely by setting fire to my tail. Let them bind me. I am not exhausted.

data.v: ततस्ते संवृताकारं सत्त्ववन्तं महाकपिम् । परिगृह्य ययुर्हृष्टा राक्षसाः कपिकुञ्जरम् ।।
data.es: Then the ogres set forth joyfully capturing the very powerful elephant among the monkeys, the great vanara who had contracted his body.

data.v: शङ्खभेरीनिनादैस्तैर्घोषयन्तः स्वकर्मभिः । राक्षसाः क्रूरकर्माणश्चारयन्ति स्म तां पुरीम् ।।
data.es: The cruel demons started blowing conches and beating drums. They paraded him in the city announcing their deeds.

data.v: हनुमांश्चारयामास राक्षसानां महापुरीम् । अथापश्यद्विमानानि विचित्राणि महाकपिः ।।
संवृतान्भूमिभागांश्च सुविभक्तांश्च चत्वरान् । रथ्याश्च गृहसंबाधाः कपिः शृङ्गाटकानि च ।।
चत्वरेषु चतुष्केषु राजमार्गे तथैव च । घोषयन्ति कपिं सर्वे चारीक इति राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: All the demons went forth through cross roads, altars built on four pillars and royal roads announcing that he (Hanuman) was a spy.

data.v: दीप्यमाने ततस्तस्य लाङ्गूलाग्रे हनूमतः । राक्षस्यस्ता विरूपाक्ष्यः शंसुर्देव्यास्तदप्रियम् ।।
data.es: When the tip of Hanuman's tail was set on fire, the uglyeyed shedemon. Carried the unpleasant news to divine Sita.

data.v: यस्त्वया कृतसंवादः सीते ताम्रमुखः कपिः । लाङ्गूलेन प्रदीप्तेन स एष परिणीयते ।।
data.es: "O Sita the redfaced monkey who conversed with you is being paraded in the streets with his tail set on fire".

data.v: श्रुत्वा तद्वचनं क्रूरमात्मापहरणोपमम् । वैदेही शोकसंतप्ता हुताशनमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Distressed on hearing the news which was as cruel as her own abduction Sita started burning with grief and invoked the firegod.

data.v: मङ्गलाभिमुखी तस्य सा तदासीन्महाकपेः । उपतस्थे विशालाक्षी प्रयता हव्यवाहनम् ।।
data.es: Wishing the great monkey well, the largeeyed Sita invoked the Firegod in her heart.

data.v: यद्यस्ति पतिशुश्रूषा यद्यस्ति चरितं तपः । यदि चास्त्येकपत्नीत्वं शीतो भव हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "O Firegod if I have served my husband, if I have practised austerities, and if I am loyal to my husband, be cool to Hanuman.

data.v: यदि कश्चिदनुक्रोशस्तस्य मय्यस्ति धीमतः । यदि वा भाग्यशेषं मे शीतो भव हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "If wise Rama has some compassion for me, if there is any residue of good luck for me, to Hanuman be cool O Firegod.

data.v: यदि मां वृत्तसंपन्नां तत्समागमलालसाम् । स विजानाति धर्मात्मा शीतो भव हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "O Firegod if Rama is righteous, if I am pure in mind, and if I am longing to unite with him, be cool to Hanuman.

data.v: यदि मां तारयत्यार्यः सुग्रीवः सत्यसंगरः । अस्माद्दुःखान्महाबाहुः शीतो भव हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "If Sugriva is true to his promise to fight (for me), if he should be able to rescue me from this ocean of agony let Hanuman be cool (not consumed by fire.)"

data.v: ततस्तीक्ष्णार्चिरव्यग्रः प्रदक्षिणशिखोऽनलः । जज्वाल मृगशावाक्ष्याः शंसन्निव शिवं कपेः ।।
data.es: Then the tips of the intense flame appeared steadily moving to the fawneyed Sita indicating the firegod's auspiciousness and safety to Hanuman.

data.v: दह्यमाने च लाङ्गूले चिन्तयामास वानरः । प्रदीप्तोऽग्निरयं कस्मान्न मां दहति सर्वतः ।।
data.es: When the tail was burning, the vanara wondered how the fire ablaze on every side was not burning him:

data.v: दृश्यते च महाज्वालः करोति च न मे रुजम् । शिशिरस्येव संपातो लाङ्गूलाग्रे प्रतिष्ठितः ।।
data.es: 'This huge flame is not hurting me. It is as though a mass of ice is placed at the end of my tail. (The fire did not torture nor extend beyond the tip of my tail.)

data.v: अथ वा तदिदं व्यक्तं यद्दृष्टं प्लवता मया । रामप्रभावादाश्चर्यं पर्वतः सरितां पतौ ।।
data.es: 'It must be due to the power of Rama, by which I found a wonderful mountain emerging from the sea to give me protection while I was crossing the ocean. Now evidently this is due to Rama's power (that my tail is not burning me).

data.v: यदि तावत्समुद्रस्य मैनाकस्य च धीमथ । रामार्थं संभ्रमस्तादृक्किमग्निर्न करिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If the anxiety of the ocean and the wise Mainaka mountain is to serve Rama what is it that the fire cannot do?

data.v: सीतायाश्चानृशंस्येन तेजसा राघवस्य च । पितुश्च मम सख्येन न मां दहति पावकः ।।
data.es: 'Because of Sita's steadfast loyalty, Rama's power and my father's friendship with the Firegod, the fire is not burning me.'

data.v: भूयः स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः । उत्पपाताथ वेगेन ननाद च महाकपिः ।।
data.es: Standing on the mountain, the elephant among monkeys pondered for a while on the means of finding Sita, in which lay the welfare of Rama.

data.v: पुरद्वारं ततः श्रीमाञ्शैलशृङ्गमिवोन्नतम् । विभक्तरक्षःसंबाधमाससादानिलात्मजः ।।
data.es: Then the illustrious Hanuman reached the entrance of the lofty city, which was like the peak of a mountain and turned away the demons.

data.v: स भूत्वा शैलसंकाशः क्षणेन पुनरात्मवान् । ह्रस्वतां परमां प्राप्तो बन्धनान्यवशातयत् ।।
data.es: From his mountainlike form he assumed his original small figure within a moment casting off the bonds.

data.v: विमुक्तश्चाभवच्छ्रीमान्पुनः पर्वतसंनिभः । वीक्षमाणश्च ददृशे परिघं तोरणाश्रितम् ।।
data.es: Illustrious Hanuman was relieved of the bond and once again grew to a mountain size. Looking around he saw an iron club near the archway.

data.v: स तं गृह्य महाबाहुः कालायसपरिष्कृतम् । रक्षिणस्तान्पुनः सर्वान्सूदयामास मारुतिः ।।
data.es: Seizing the black Iron club again, the strongarmed Hanuman killed all the demon guards.

data.v: स तान्निहत्वा रणचण्डविक्रमः; समीक्षमाणः पुनरेव लङ्काम् । प्रदीप्तलाङ्गूलकृतार्चिमाली; प्रकाशतादित्य इवांशुमाली ।।
data.es: Hanuman, who was of fearsome valour in war with the demons, having killed them, gazed at Lanka once again. Garlanded by the flames of his tail around, he shone like the Sun covered with garlands of rays. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: वीक्षमाणस्ततो लङ्कां कपिः कृतमनोरथः । वर्धमानसमुत्साहः कार्यशेषमचिन्तयत् ।।
data.es: With his objectives achieved, the monkey gazed at Lanka with growing zeal and pondered over the remaining work.

data.v: किं नु खल्वविशिष्टं मे कर्तव्यमिह साम्प्रतम् । यदेषां रक्षसां भूयः संतापजननं भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'Is there anything still left which can further torment the demons here?

data.v: वनं तावत्प्रमथितं प्रकृष्टा राक्षसा हताः । बलैकदेशः क्षपितः शेषं दुर्गविनाशनम् ।।
दुर्गे विनाशिते कर्म भवेत्सुखपरिश्रमम् । अल्पयत्नेन कार्येऽस्मिन्मम स्यात्सफलः श्रमः ।।
data.es: 'If the citadel is destroyed it would be a happy conclusion with a little effort. I can successfully complete my task.

data.v: यो ह्ययं मम लाङ्गूले दीप्यते हव्यवाहनः । अस्य संतर्पणं न्याय्यं कर्तुमेभिर्गृहोत्तमैः ।।
data.es: 'It would be proper to satiate this fire at the end of my tail by offering it to these excellent mansions (I shall set fire to these houses).

data.v: ततः प्रदीप्तलाङ्गूलः सविद्युदिव तोयदः । भवनाग्रेषु लङ्काया विचचार महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The great Hanuman, with his burning tail wandered on tops of the mansions of Lanka, which looked like clouds with lightning.

data.v: मुमोच हनुमानग्निं कालानलशिखोपमम् ।।
श्वसनेन च संयोगादतिवेगो महाबलः । कालाग्निरिव जज्वाल प्रावर्धत हुताशनः ।।
data.es: The windgod's association made the fire spread at great speed. It appeared like fire at the time of dissolution.

data.v: प्रदीप्तमग्निं पवनस्तेषु वेश्मसु चारयत् ।।
data.es: Combined with the wind the fire began to spread, burning the houses with great speed.

data.v: तानि काञ्चनजालानि मुक्तामणिमयानि च । भवनान्यवशीर्यन्त रत्नवन्ति महान्ति च ।।
data.es: The palatial structures with windows of golden meshwork, embedded with pearls and gems and other precious stones tumbled.

data.v: तानि भग्नविमानानि निपेतुर्वसुधातले । भवनानीव सिद्धानामम्बरात्पुण्यसंक्षये ।।
वज्रविद्रुमवैदूर्यमुक्तारजतसंहितान् । विचित्रान्भवनाद्धातून्स्यन्दमानान्ददर्श सः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw many colourful molten minerals mixed with diamonds, corals vaiduryas, pearls and silver flowing (dropping) from every mansion.

data.v: नाग्निस्तृप्यति काष्ठानां तृणानां च यथा तथा । हनूमान्राक्षसेन्द्राणां वधे किंचिन्न तृप्यति ।।
data.es: Just as fire is not satisfied with dry sticks and grass Hanuman was not satisfied with the dead demons.

data.v: हुताशनज्वालसमावृता सा; हतप्रवीरा परिवृत्तयोधा । हनूमातः क्रोधबलाभिभूता; बभूव शापोपहतेव लङ्का ।।

ch.n: उपजाति त्रिष्टुभ्: अज्ञातम् [११: यतजगग], उपेन्द्रवज्रा [११: जतजगग]

data.es: With the Fire god spreading flames all over, heroes dead, retreating troops shattered by Hanuman's anger, Lanka appeared as though it was cursed.

data.v: ससंभ्रमं त्रस्तविषण्णराक्षसां; समुज्ज्वलज्ज्वालहुताशनाङ्किताम् । ददर्श लङ्कां हनुमान्महामनाः; स्वयम्भुकोपोपहतामिवावनिम् ।।
data.es: Highly sensitive Hanuman saw the city of Lanka filled with perplexed, scared and sorrowful demons, Lanka succumbed to the flames of firegod and looked as if it was hit by the anger of Brahma, the selfborn god.

data.v: स राक्षसांस्तान्सुबहूंश्च हत्वा; वनं च भङ्क्त्वा बहुपादपं तत् । विसृज्य रक्षो भवनेषु चाग्निं; जगाम रामं मनसा महात्मा ।।
data.es: Great Hanuman, sought Rama's presence in his mind after killing many demons, breaking down many trees of the garden, and setting fire to the mansions of demons.

data.v: लङ्कां समस्तां संदीप्य लाङ्गूलाग्निं महाकपिः । निर्वापयामास तदा समुद्रे हरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman, having burnt the entire city of Lanka, put out the fire on his tail in the ocean. Beholding the burning city, the destroyed gardens and the panic stricken ogres, he began to think:

data.v: संदीप्यमानां विध्वस्तां त्रस्तरक्षो गणां पुरीम् । अवेक्ष्य हानुमाँल्लङ्कां चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman, having burnt the entire city of Lanka, put out the fire on his tail in the ocean. Beholding the burning city, the destroyed gardens and the panic stricken ogres, he began to think:

data.v: तस्याभूत्सुमहांस्त्रासः कुत्सा चात्मन्यजायत । लङ्कां प्रदहता कर्म किंस्वित्कृतमिदं मया ।।
data.es: Overtaken by great fear, Hanuman felt a sense of selfreproach seeing Lanka reduced to ashes, and said, ' Lanka is burnt. What a heinous action has been perpetrated by me'.

data.v: धन्यास्ते पुरुषश्रेष्ठ ये बुद्ध्या कोपमुत्थितम् । निरुन्धन्ति महात्मानो दीप्तमग्निमिवाम्भसा ।।
data.es: 'Blessed indeed are the highsouled men, who in their wisdom restrain their own anger as one would put off burning fire with water.

data.v: यदि दग्धा त्वियं लङ्का नूनमार्यापि जानकी । दग्धा तेन मया भर्तुर्हतं कार्यमजानता ।।
data.es: 'If this Lanka is burnt, even noble Janaki is burnt, my master's work is spoilt by me unknowingly.

data.v: यदर्थमयमारम्भस्तत्कार्यमवसादितम् । मया हि दहता लङ्कां न सीता परिरक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'My very mission is foiled. Sita has not been protected by me for no part of Lanka has escaped unburnt.

data.v: ईषत्कार्यमिदं कार्यं कृतमासीन्न संशयः । तस्य क्रोधाभिभूतेन मया मूलक्षयः कृतः ।।
विनष्टा जानकी व्यक्तं न ह्यदग्धः प्रदृश्यते । लङ्कायाः कश्चिदुद्देशः सर्वा भस्मीकृता पुरी ।।
data.es: 'Surely Janaki has perished in Lanka, for not even a little place is left unburnt. The entire city is reduced to ashes.

data.v: यदि तद्विहतं कार्यं मया प्रज्ञाविपर्ययात् । इहैव प्राणसंन्यासो ममापि ह्यतिरोचते ।।
data.es: 'If my work has been destroyed by my perversity of judgement, I will give up my life now and here itself'.

data.v: किमग्नौ निपताम्यद्य आहोस्विद्वडवामुखे । शरीरमाहो सत्त्वानां दद्मि सागरवासिनाम् ।।
data.es: 'Shall I end my life by jumping into fire just now, or else into the mouth of submarine fire? Should I offer my body to the living creatures of the ocean as their food?

data.v: कथं हि जीवता शक्यो मया द्रष्टुं हरीश्वरः । तौ वा पुरुषशार्दूलौ कार्यसर्वस्वघातिना ।।
data.es: 'Having spoilt the entire work how can I show my face to the king of monkeys? How is it possible to see both the tigers among men?

data.v: मया खलु तदेवेदं रोषदोषात्प्रदर्शितम् । प्रथितं त्रिषु लोकेषु कपितमनवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'On account of my mistake of yielding to anger, I have exhibited the unstable monkeynature and made it well established in the three worlds.

data.v: धिगस्तु राजसं भावमनीशमनवस्थितम् । ईश्वरेणापि यद्रागान्मया सीता न रक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'Fie upon my hasty action commited due to lack of selfcontrol. I did not save Sita eventhough the entire situation was under my control. (I had the capacity to save her. But I failed due to anger.)

data.v: विनष्टायां तु सीतायां तावुभौ विनशिष्यतः । तयोर्विनाशे सुग्रीवः सबन्धुर्विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If the two princes know about Sita's loss they will die and when they are dead Sugriva would perish along with all his relatives.

data.v: एतदेव वचः श्रुत्वा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः । धर्मात्मा सहशत्रुघ्नः कथं शक्ष्यति जीवितुम् ।।
data.es: 'How will the loving righteous brother, Bharata along with Satrughna survive after hearing this?

data.v: इक्ष्वाकुवंशे धर्मिष्ठे गते नाशमसंशयम् । भविष्यन्ति प्रजाः सर्वाः शोकसंतापपीडिताः ।।
data.es: 'When the righteous Ikshvaku race perishes the people would be tormented by grief and remorse. There is no doubt.

data.v: तदहं भाग्यरहितो लुप्तधर्मार्थसंग्रहः । रोषदोषपरीतात्मा व्यक्तं लोकविनाशनः ।।
data.es: 'I have failed in seeking dharma and artha. It is evident is that I am a destroyer of the world because I was overtaken by anger. How unfortunate I am'

data.v: इति चिन्तयतस्तस्य निमित्तान्युपपेदिरे । पूरमप्युपलब्धानि साक्षात्पुनरचिन्तयत् ।।
data.es: When Hanuman was thus bemoaning, good omens as in the past appeared before him. He started reflecting once again:

data.v: अथ वा चारुसर्वाङ्गी रक्षिता स्वेन तेजसा । न नशिष्यति कल्याणी नाग्निरग्नौ प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: 'On the other hand a beautiful and auspicious lady like Sita will be protected by her own splendour and will not perish as fire cannot extinguish fire. (Sita is pure like fire. Here the great sage Valmiki is suggesting the future incident in which Sita emerged safe from 'Agnipariksha' or fireordeal.)

data.v: न हि धर्मान्मनस्तस्य भार्याममिततेजसः । स्वचारित्राभिगुप्तां तां स्प्रष्टुमर्हति पावकः ।।
data.es: 'Fire cannot touch that lady who is protected by her own chastity and who is wedded to the righteous man of immasureable glory.

data.v: नूनं रामप्रभावेन वैदेह्याः सुकृतेन च । यन्मां दहनकर्मायं नादहद्धव्यवाहनः ।।
data.es: 'Fire, the consumer of oblations who has the property of burning has not burnt me and this is surely on account of Rama's power and Vaidehi's merits.

data.v: त्रयाणां भरतादीनां भ्रातॄणां देवता च या । रामस्य च मनःकान्ता सा कथं विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'To Bharata, Lakshmana and Satrughna she is a goddess and she is dear to Rama's heart, how would she perish?

data.v: यद्वा दहनकर्मायं सर्वत्र प्रभुरव्ययः । न मे दहति लाङ्गूलं कथमार्यां प्रधक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If not so, the firegod who never fails in burning has not burnt my tail. How will he burn noble Sita?'

data.v: तपसा सत्यवाक्येन अनन्यत्वाच्च भर्तरि । अपि सा निर्दहेदग्निं न तामग्निः प्रधक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'By virtue of her power of asceticism, power of truthfulness and exclusive devotion towards her husband, she may consume the fire. Fire will not burn her'.

data.v: स तथा चिन्तयंस्तत्र देव्या धर्मपरिग्रहम् । शुश्राव हनुमान्वाक्यं चारणानां महात्मनाम् ।।
data.es: As Hanuman was thinking so, he heard the words of the great charanas who were praising the queen's power of righteousness.

data.v: अहो खलु कृतं कर्म दुर्विषह्यं हनूमता । अग्निं विसृजताभीक्ष्णं भीमं राक्षससद्मनि ।।
data.es: 'Oh Hanuman has indeed accomplished the marvellous task of spreading the terrific fire on the demons buildings.

data.v: दग्धेयं नगरी लङ्का साट्टप्राकारतोरणा । जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोऽद्भुत एव नः ।।
data.es: 'The city with its towering markets, ramparts and portals is burnt, but Janaki is not. It is really wonderful, strange

data.v: स निमित्तैश्च दृष्टार्थैः कारणैश्च महागुणैः । ऋषिवाक्यैश्च हनुमानभवत्प्रीतमानसः ।।
data.es: With omens that proved to be right and for good reasons and from the words of the sages (charanas), Hanuman felt happy.

data.v: ततः कपिः प्राप्तमनोरथार्थ;स्तामक्षतां राजसुतां विदित्वा । प्रत्यक्षतस्तां पुनरेव दृष्ट्वा; प्रतिप्रयाणाय मतिं चकार ।।
data.es: Hanuman, having fulfilled his desires and knowing that Sita is not hurt, thought of departing after meeting Sita once again (to testify that she is really safe).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततस्तु शिंशपामूले जानकीं पर्यवस्थिताम् । अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्दिष्ट्या पश्यामि त्वामिहाक्षताम् ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman offered salutations to Janaki, stationed at the foot of the simsupa tree, and said, "Luckily I see you unscathed."

data.v: ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः । भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमभाषत ।।
data.es: Sita again and again looked at Hanuman who was about to start. She made him understand her words conveying her love for Rama.

data.v: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने । पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः ।।
data.es: "O slayer of enemy heroes if you alone can accomplish this task the fame of doing this will be yours.

data.v: बलैस्तु संकुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः । मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तस्य तत्सादृशं भवेत् ।।
data.es: "If Kakutstha (Rama), slayer of the enemy army fills the entire Lanka with his arrows and takes me, then his action will be worthy of him.

data.v: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः । भवत्याहवशूरस्य तत्त्वमेवोपपादय ।।
data.es: "You may make arrangement in such a manner that, that great self, the hero in war makes his victorious march which is worthy of him."

data.v: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम् । निशम्य हनुमांस्तस्या वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the meaningful, courteous and logical words of Sita, Hanuman replied:

data.v: क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थो हर्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः । यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीञ्शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Kakutstha Rama, accompanied by vanaras and bears will reach here soon and conquer the enemies in war and relieve your grief.

data.v: एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीमभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Questioned thus by Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod started describing Rama's physique as it is.

data.v: ततः स कपिशार्दूलः स्वामिसंदर्शनोत्सुकः । आरुरोह गिरिश्रेष्ठमरिष्टमरिमर्दनः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman, the crusher of enemies, a tiger among vanaras anxious to see his lord ascended the mount Arishta.

data.v: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभिर्नीलाभिर्वनराजिभिः । सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च वंशैश्च बहुभिर्वृतम् ।।
data.es: Mount Arishta was full of blue forestranges with choicest tall padmaka trees. With clouds hanging on the slopes of mountain peaks, it appeared as though the mountain was wrapped in an upper garment.

data.v: लतावितानैर्विततैः पुष्पवद्भिरलंकृतम् । नानामृगगणाकीर्णं धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम् ।।
data.es: It was spread with creepers filled with beautiful flowers and herds of animals. The colourful minerals flowing down decorated the mountain.

data.v: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतं शिलासंचयसंकटम् । महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिंनरोरगसेवितम् ।।
data.es: There were many streams of water flowing and rocks making it difficult for the streams to flow. The mountain was inhabited by sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas, and uragas.

data.v: लतापादपसंबाधं सिंहाकुलितकन्दरम् । व्याघ्रसंघसमाकीर्णं स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम् ।।
data.es: The clusters of creepers, and trees bearing tasty fruits and roots were uprooted. There were caves inhabited by lions. Herds of tigers were scattered all over (by the impetus of Hanuman's pressure on the mountain).

data.v: तमारुरोहातिबलः पर्वतं प्लवगोत्तमः । रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण प्रहर्षेणाभिचोदितः ।।
data.es: Anxious to see Rama soon, the son of the Windgod ascended the mountain happily.

data.v: तेन पादतलाक्रान्ता रम्येषु गिरिसानुषु । सघोषाः समशीर्यन्त शिलाश्चूर्णीकृतास्ततः ।।
data.es: Crushed under Hanuman's feet the rocks making a loud noise on the beautiful mountain ranges rolled down, reduced to powder.

data.v: स तमारुह्य शैलेन्द्रं व्यवर्धत महाकपिः । दक्षिणादुत्तरं पारं प्रार्थयँल्लवणाम्भसः ।।
data.es: On ascending the king of mountains, desiring to reach the northern shore of the saltwater ocean from the Southern shore, he enlarged his body (in preparation to leap).

data.v: अधिरुह्य ततो वीरः पर्वतं पवनात्मजः । ददर्श सागरं भीमं मीनोरगनिषेवितम् ।।
data.es: Then the heroic son of the Windgod, who had ascended the mountain saw the dreadful ocean inhabited by fishes and snakes.

data.v: स मारुत इवाकाशं मारुतस्यात्मसंभवः । प्रपेदे हरिशार्दूलो दक्षिणादुत्तरां दिशम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the tiger among monkeys leaped into the sky like the Windgod from the south to the north shore.

data.v: स तदा पीडितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः । ररास सह तैर्भूतैः प्राविशद्वसुधातलम् । कम्पमानैश्च शिखरैः पतद्भिरपि च द्रुमैः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: सरभज], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयय], अज्ञातम् [१२: नरनर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरनम]

data.es: Pressed under the feet of Hanuman, the great mountain made loud sound sinking into the earth along with all its creatures, with its shaken mountain peaks and uprooted trees dropping down.

data.v: तस्योरुवेगान्मथिताः पादपाः पुष्पशालिनः । निपेतुर्भूतले रुग्णाः शक्रायुधहता इव ।।
data.es: Shaken by the violent force of Hanuman's thighs, the blossoming trees fell on the ground like sickmen hit by Indra's thunderbolt.

data.v: कन्दरोदरसंस्थानां पीडितानां महौजसाम् । सिंहानां निनदो भीमो नभो भिन्दन्स शुश्रुवे ।।
data.es: The dreadful roar of strong lions, lying in mountaincaves was heard cracking the sky when they were crushed in the turmoil.

data.v: स्रस्तव्याविद्धवसना व्याकुलीकृतभूषणा । विद्याधर्यः समुत्पेतुः सहसा धरणीधरात् ।।
data.es: The Vidyadharis with their clothes slipped and ornaments disarrayed in fear, at once flew from the mountain.

data.v: अतिप्रमाणा बलिनो दीप्तजिह्वा महाविषाः । निपीडितशिरोग्रीवा व्यवेष्टन्त महाहयः ।।
data.es: Highly powerful, huge and poisonous snakes with their glowing tongues protruded, pressed on their heads and necks (by Hanuman).

data.v: किंनरोरगगन्धर्वयक्षविद्याधरास्तथा । पीडितं तं नगवरं त्यक्त्वा गगनमास्थिताः ।।
data.es: Then the kinnaras, uragas, gandhravas, yakshas and vidyadharas left the tortured mountain and occupied the sky.

data.v: स च भूमिधरः श्रीमान्बलिना तेन पीडितः । सवृक्षशिखरोदग्राः प्रविवेश रसातलम् ।।
data.es: Crushed by the powerful Hanuman, that prosperous mountain with its trees standing and tall peaks sank into the underworld.

data.v: दशयोजनविस्तारस्त्रिंशद्योजनमुच्छ्रितः । धरण्यां समतां यातः स बभूव धराधरः ।।
data.es: That mountain of ten yojanas in width and thirty yojanas in height got levelled with the earth.

data.v: सचन्द्रकुमुदं रम्यं सार्ककारण्डवं शुभम् । तिष्यश्रवणकदम्बमभ्रशैवलशाद्वलम् ।।
पुनर्वसु महामीनं लोहिताङ्गमहाग्रहम् । ऐरावतमहाद्वीपं स्वातीहंसविलोडितम् ।।
वातसंघातजातोर्मिं चन्द्रांशुशिशिराम्बुमत् । भुजंगयक्षगन्धर्वप्रबुद्धकमलोत्पलम् ।।
ग्रसमान इवाकाशं ताराधिपमिवालिखन् । हरन्निव सनक्षत्रं गगनं सार्कमण्डलम् ।।
data.es: Great Hanuman, son of the Windgod, flew through the abode of the Windgod as if he was swallowing the space, scratching the Moon, lord of the stars, as if seizing the heavens along with the constellation of Sun and stars and as though he was drawing the clusters of clouds.

data.v: मारुतस्यालयं श्रीमान्कपिर्व्योमचरो महान् । हनूमान्मेघजालानि विकर्षन्निव गच्छति ।।
data.es: Great Hanuman, son of the Windgod, flew through the abode of the Windgod as if he was swallowing the space, scratching the Moon, lord of the stars, as if seizing the heavens along with the constellation of Sun and stars and as though he was drawing the clusters of clouds.

data.v: पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि नीलमाञ्जिष्ठकानि च । हरितारुणवर्णानि महाभ्राणि चकाशिरे ।।
data.es: While Hanuman was drawing big clouds which were either white or red or blue or yellow, he looked charming.

data.v: प्रविशन्नभ्रजालानि निष्क्रमंश्च पुनः पुनः । प्रच्छन्नश्च प्रकाशश्च चन्द्रमा इव लक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: Entering into and emerging from the clouds, he looked like the Moon that appears and disappears (behind a bank of clouds).

data.v: नदन्नादेन महता मेघस्वनमहास्वनः । आजगाम महातेजाः पुनर्मध्येन सागरम् ।।
पर्वतेन्द्रं सुनाभं च समुपस्पृश्य वीर्यवान् । ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचो महावेगोऽभ्युपागतः ।।
data.es: The valiant Hanuman touched the lord of mountains fondly and went with great speed just as an arrow released from the centre of a powerful bowstring.

data.v: स किंचिदनुसंप्राप्तः समालोक्य महागिरिम् । महेन्द्रमेघसंकाशं ननाद हरिपुंगवः ।।
data.es: The chief of the monkeys arrived near, and beholding the face of the Mahendra mountain, which resembled a mass of clouds, thundered.

data.v: निशम्य नदतो नादं वानरास्ते समन्ततः । बभूवुरुत्सुकाः सर्वे सुहृद्दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
